content:
r 14, 2014
												**Edit** : If you look below my original bit, I went into a little more depth about how this game is pay to win, if you're not convinced. I don't cover all the reasons, but I do cover one of the main ones. Please, take my word for it, you don't want to play this game past the early game.EXTREMELY pay to win. The end game is utter ♥♥♥♥ for this reason along with various other problems ranging from lack of content to game breaking bugs that take forever to fix to extremely unbalanced classes.Nexon just doesn't care. Don't play this game, it's not worth your time. Find a private server, their service and gameplay is generally better.**Edit**I'm going to add this in due to some comments I've been getting about the game not being pay to win. Sorry if it's a bit disorganized, since this was meant to be a comment, however it went over the 1000 character limit :The potential system, to those who have not played this game yet, is basically an extra 2-3 stats tagged onto almost any peice of equipment. These stats account for the majority of a player's strength/damage, much more so than the stats you regularly get through upgrading items by in game means. These stats start out very poorly, and are rolled randomly by using what is called a cube. Occassionally, the tier of the potential will go up when you roll (This is quite rare, maybe 1 in 30 rolls give or take. Some people need around 100 if they're unlucky), giving access to better potentials. Note that these potentials are RNG, so as a warrior, you may very well get DEX, INT, LUK, M.ATK or any other useless stat 95% of rolls.To get a single cube through in game means takes up to a week, more or less. Crafting them is ludicrously expensive and trying to obtain them from killing bosses is pointless due to the ludicrously low drop rate ( To get one cube, you'd have to do a twice daily boss each day for on average a month, give or take. I say this from personal experience ).Of course, you could always BUY cubes. They're $1-$2 each (The $2 one is necessary for upgrading the final tier ), or they come in $10 and $20 bundles. Note that it's ONE DOLLAR TO BUY A SINGLE CUBE. Making a single end game tier item can take HUNDREDS OF CUBES, and that will get you almost NOWHERE progress wise. You need a FULL SET of these types of items to have a CHANCE at one of the end game bosses. This, coupled with the fact that group play is extremely discouraged in boss fights makes these end game bosses impossible (The HP on these bosses is in the hundred billions. Consider that I, a long time player who doesn't spend money can't shave even a fraction of their HP bars in 10 minutes. Now consider that most bosses have a 20 - 30 minute time limit).It is also impossible to make money in the game from 'end game' activities, because unless you have an extremely high damage range, all the bosses you will be able to fight have useless drops.I didn't even mention the fact that a lot of boss drops are trade locked unless you pay $2-$3 to untrade lock it for one trade.

number of helpful: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
y 27, 2015
												*Long wall of text sorry but this was on my mind for a long time*I use to play Maplestory a lot in the past, it was one of my most enjoyed games, like many I played since the early days, it was great, there was a whole lot you can do, even if there was limited classes at the time, heck not even 3rd job was in game but it was still awesome.Long ago tho I had lost interest within Mapelstory, not due to the game being boring, lack of things to do, well kind of, after a certain change it made the game become horrible in my eyes, due to making everything to simple, to easy and just lacking what Maplestory was long ago, causing it to lose what made MS fun and enjoyable.I know you might be asking "what was the change that caused you to say such things, lashing out at this game, it is still quite fun and I like it." the thing that broke the game was the addition of  the "Big Bang" update, what broke it wasn't the new classes or game play, the new areas you can explore and or the ability now to craft items and gear, no what to me broke Maplestory was that Nexon messed with the EXP tabels making it so you can hit max level without even trying.Sure it might not sound bad to you, tho here is  a list and examples ofwhat problems this caused for me and probably others.1. This update made PQs useless and really any type of party related things useless [PQ = Party quest] you would in the past need to make a group of 5 + people to go into dungeons, the dungeons would depending on where you had been in game need a certain group in order to play/beat it, like in Ludi PQ, you needed 1-2 mages, 1 theif, 1-2 warriors or so or a archer class in order to do areas within the quest, the theif would use their darkness skill [or what ever it is called] in order to sneek into a room full of mobs that 1 hit KO you, the mages would use their teleport skill to warp to spots others can't hit and the archer would use their bow and arrows for distance kills, the warrior was for dmg and tanking of the bossesI know this is a long text wall and I am sorry, the memories I use to have of making friends while in line waiting to do a PQ was awesome, having to do dungeon raids with them was great, the reason I also mention it makes doing parties useless is now that the exp tables have changed someone can solo lvl faster then when in a party, sure a nice exp buff from a Bishop is nice tho it isn't needed.2. The game is super easy to level up in now, in the past it use to take people atleast 1-2 years to hit level 200 sure I know that is a long time, tho now you can within 1-7 days hit that, since all you need to do is find out where high exp monsters spawn and grind kill them, now this is another factor as well, this will cause you to KS people [KS = Kill steal]  who happen to be doing the same thing as you and or would be doing the same thing as you.3. Changing of the classes, some for the good, the rest for the worst, I made a Dragon Knight, wanting to use it how it was in the past, you know with dragon roar, anyone remember that attack? I sure hope so, it was quite a scary and powerful attack that would hit 16 or so mobs within the AOE range for massive dmg and this was a warrior based class, that also you didn't have to be job class 4 to use it, only needed to be lvl 70, well now the Dragon Knight has been changed to be more of a spear based class, so dragon roar is gone, the most useful skill in my eyes for lvling up, I forgot the rest of the changes to it, tho it seems they gut a lot of classes for the worst.I will end this review here, I do like Maplestory, tho since the Big Bang update, it broke the game in my eyes, no longer do you need a party, you can just KS grind up to lvl 200 + by your self, they made the game to easy, if they could only add alt servers in that played like before the exp tabel changes but keep all of the new classes and what not, I think it would be more fun, since you would have to party up with people in order to get any where, it made me angry to see they would change their full game on their hard core fans like this and bring the game down the to such a level.

content:
ry 18, 2016
												I've played this game for years before it became available on Steam. Loved it. Logged many hours on it. Met some amazing people on it. The artwork was engaging, and the gameplay was reminesent of the 2D scrollers I played in the 80s. To this very day, I still love it. But do I recommend it ? In its latest form, can I recommend it to the new players?Sadly, no.Call me an"old school Mapler", but I can't recommend this game anymore. Why? For a number of reasons. Here is a few:-The core Explorer classes have been overshadowed by the numerous and, to a degree, overpowered new classes. Granted, this was all part of the overall storyline, but I still love the original classes more.-What hooked me most was the social aspect of the early days (year 3 onward...). Waiting to hop onto the big airship or waiting for the subway to come encouraged me to interact with the others as we waited. Since the big airship was all but replaced with the option to rent a private plane, the socializing is now almost non-existant.-Free Market now is a joke. Unless you can grind for hours in order to farm for "mesos", or can buy "meso bags" with real cash, nearly everything on sale in Free Market is grossly overpriced.While the features that were added over over time are helpful, I can't recommend this game to the new player. While it is still fun to play, MapleStory has moved to close to the "pay-to-win" mechanic that too many FTP games have become.

, 2015
												I have played this game since 2007-2008 and I can tell you the game has not only declined, it's plummeted. Hackers and botters were always an issue so I won't touch on that, as well as the P2W nature. We all know P2W is bad and I've sunk easily far too much money into this while I was still on my parents' alllowance. Still, many MMOs follow that route and I've become inured to it.No, what gets me is how far the game likes to think it's come when in reality it hasn't moved at all. On the one hand, I like the multiple character classes, as even though they feel just like all the others of their niche(Tank, glass cannon, rogue, etc.) there's little perks that make the classes interesting for a time(My favorite so far being Mechanic, though since I haven't played in ages they've likely been nerfed). That leads me to one of my main gripes: The lack of balancing for the numerous new classes. Not only that, but the game itself doesn't change to suit each new class and their newfound overpowered strengths or crippling weaknesses. This leads to many classes being pointless or obsolete(Who even plays as the classic four/five character classes anymore?) which clutters up the game.The game itself is very cluttered, as well. I get that traveling is a big part of any MMO or any game with a large world for that matter, but if your game is a 2D, linear style, the back and forth of traveling is a lot more tedious than choosing the shortest route in a 3D game. Not only that, many parts of the maps are just lines with no connecting rooms or hubs, leading to a lot of needless backtracking. However, this is another feature of the game that I got used to(Though pre big bang the map was a circle, which was very nice).Those are my two biggest qualms right now, though for the most part I don't feel comfortable completely bashing this game since I've had so much fun with it since when my brother introduced me to it as a young teen. I wouldn't recommend it in the state it's in, though. I'm going to try Mabinogi and other Nexon MMOs, though, because I've heard they're better now than Maplestory has been in a long time.

content:
y 21, 2015
												Whut.Why is this game still alive?---Half a decade ago, MapleStory could be considered a pretty decent game. Four classes, places to go, and you can conduct social activities/experiments? Welp, sign me up!Except that was 5 years ago. Now, I felt that the game is just swamped with 'features' (being that they are a little more than gimmicks). PvP arena has, in my experience, died out after a few months of activity 3-4 years ago. I'm now swamped with event quests that I'm not even interested in doing. Hell, even the community as gone worst over the last five years. I still remember the times where, at the boat from Ellina to Orbis, the players, as passagers, would do some kind of crazy shenanigans to pass the time (hell, there are dedicated Balrog killers just in case one showed up). Now? you buy a plane mount, head to the station, go into transit, and then stare into the screen in boredom as you count down the timer. Now, if you are the adventuring type, prepare to lone-wolf the game 90% of the time; most of the 'social' groups camp in Henesys nowadays.And the grinding. Yeah, prepare to mindlessly grind your way through. At least a few years ago you would have parties that would happily join you. Now? *sigh*Five years ago, I would of recommended this game. Now? Nah. Look for something else, or do stuff in real life. Now, any task is more useful than this failure of a time-waster.

content:
y 1, 2015
												I started playing this game way back in 2005 when it was still technically in beta. I played for a long time.  It took six months just to get to level TWENTY!! Now... it takes literally 10 minutes.  There was something great and fresh about the game. At the time, it had four classes.  Now, over thirty.  To be perfectly honest.  Once the breaking (an event in game that reshaped the map and landscape) happened a couple years back the game went from being awesome to being unimportant.  No longer did I feel connected to my character or the world around me with its great stories and characters.  It became all about how much damage a character could put out and how fast you can max your levels (and with multiple classes).Maple Story is a game I love, a game I cherish in my memories and had some really great fun playing with many of my friends.  I would love to recommend but can no longer do that.  The game I love is no more.  I really just doesn't exist anymore. All that being said, I have read and heard others saying that they always come back to it.  I will admit, I usually check it out for a few days every 6 - 12 months.  Nothing has changed though... the lack of charm is still gone.  Sad.  Really sad.Miss my Maple

content:
y 19
												To me I had fun in this game, it felt like a genuine adventure, a place to explore with unique landscapes and monsters. None of this "save the world", "your the choosen one", class backgrounds filled with melodramatic tragedy of a chosen underdog. Just a simple adventure game, like the original classes are called. Though I am sure that people who only know of this itteration of maplestory can't quite understand what it was like, but the best way I can put it is.... it could be frustrating and cruel but it was fun and forced people into situations where they could connect and converse. There was a time in which certain maps acted as chat rooms/lounges. People would show off their equipment and levels, share stories, tips, guide new players, tell jokes, help other players through leeching parties, trade valuable items. Sometimes people (myself included) would drop exccess gold or rare loot that we either couldn't use or were not interested in. This was before gold had value beyond pots, so items were goods that were traded for other goods, occasionally gold (for pots). It was a far less... toxic feeling place. Far less bugs too.Wrote a rant about how they simplified everything and stripped away the uniqueness and challenge of certain classes in pursuit of molding every class into the same thing with different visual animations. And with this story stuff it just feels condescending to it's target audience. They could write a better story..... I'll stop here.

												okay, so I've played this game on and off probably since I was 10 or 11 years old. I have put countless hours into this game and it will forever and always hold a speical place in my heart.That being said...The GoodThis game is MASSIVE! By virtue of it being such a long standing MMO, it has more conntent then I could ever hope to see.Grinding (And ooohhhh yeah there's A LOT of that...) has some suprising little challenges that make it more tolorable.It has a unique artstyle and gameplay as compared to most MMO's.It has a lot of charm if you're willing to sit through the other stuff.The BadUm... There's a whole lot.The comunity seems to have fallen appart. I've heard of MMO's with toxic comunities. Maplestory's is non existant. There's a group of max level players that seem to... enjoy? them? Selves? (They sit in cities waiting for people to "fame" them.) I Actively attempted to have social interactions with other individuals, and failed. Miserably. They're just... not there. Or they simply seem to not care. At all. It's so borring to do anything after a while. I've been playing since I was ten, and it probably took me 25+ hours just getting one character to level 100 (Which is less than half-way to max level) and... it wasn't fun after the inital 20 or so. I did it just because it was like my childhood dream to have a character at the final job advancement.Also, balance is non-existant. Certain classes are just WAY more fun and WAY stronger than other classes. That's just part of the game. (I guess that's not nessisarily bad. It's just something to be aware of)The UglyIt's... it's an old game. It shows. It feels like they keep trying to put more and more paint on it, and now it feels like it's just that... Paint. A facsimile of it's former self. Almost like someone has taken a dead relative and taxadermised they're corpse and prettends like they're still alive. (A bit of an extreme example, but acurate nonetheless.)The end.I am done with this game, it's not fun for me anymore. If you decide to play it, maybe you'll find something I didn't and have more fun then I did. I sinceerly hope you do. But I honestly suggest you play a different game. or wait for Maplestory 2 to come out. I know I'll be giving it a shot, haha. (Seriously, it's a thing give it a look.)

												This was my favorite game ever back then. Even if I couldn't get past level 40 (due to the sheer stupidity of a child's mind), I still played it daily and never got tired.Going back to this game a few months ago, for the sake of nostalgia or what not, it took me just barely a week to get bored of it.-The game, at its core, is now a complete grindfest for clearing maps of monsters every 10 seconds.-The community that was upon a time is now long gone.-You can speed through levels like nothing, what was once two week's work to get to lv 30 (a month's work prior Big Bang patch!), is now less than a day's work. There is barely any feeling for accomplishment left.- A LOT of party quests are now easily soloable. There is no point for looking for party members to do them (not that there is much of a community left to do so).In a nutshell, that's what I found of the game I once loved. I still do love it for what it gave me then, but not as it is and what it offers now.If you want a quick nostalgia trip, go for it. Install the game, give it a few days to a week or two, then leave it.If you're looking for a game to invest gameplay time in, take yourself somewhere else.

content:
0, 2016
												This is a review based around the Reboot server. Reboot was one of the major goods the Nexon did to this game, and it was an update big enough to bring the community back to life in its last dying breaths. Nexon America, notorious for focusing only on pushing out content and collecting as much profit as possible, rose above and listened to the community for the first time in a while. They finally addressed the fact that their game was heavily pay-to-win based. I do agree that it was rather scummy to save this as a last resort instead of doing it earlier, but the fact remains that they did it, even at the risk of losing money.Reboot is a GMS server different from all the others, in that the only items you can buy using real money are purely cosmetic, aside from pets. Pets are definitely needed for fast grinding of mesos in the late-game, but even they can be earned by killing Hilla, a mid-game boss.MapleStory will always hold a place in my heart, even long after I leave. Through the layers of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t Nexon coated the game in, there's a genuinely good game with an expansive world and a great community. I was long gone and done with the regular servers but Reboot brought me and tens of thousands of other players back, allowing everyone an equal oppurtunity.We can even see now that Nexon is slowly beginning to address bugs and balance issues. In recent patches, Nexon was also able to add new content that was meaningful and well made, while also balancing characters and fixing bugs. They also give out items if ever they make mistakes that mislead players or affect gameplay, fixing it right away as well.I have many other things to say about the game, but I think everything beyond what I've said so far is purely subjective and will be up to the player whether or not they like it.

content:
3, 2016
 First a little background I have played maplestory since early 2006 and I've kept playing since then. I have 6 level 200+ characters amd will continue to make more. I am an MMORPG fanatic and I really enjoy the 2D side-scolling games. I recently got Maplestory on steam to avoid using the horrendus Nexon client. Review This game has a lot of grinding. A lot of grinding. Much like WoW, in Maplestory you constantly grind and are trying to level up your character to get better gear, a new job advancment, etc. That is one of the aspects I love the most about this game. In a game such as WoW you get new abilities every 4-5 levels depending on what level you are, in Maplestory you get things called job advancments. Basically, you have a certain moveset with certain abilities, you can upgrade these abilites until you reach a certain level, and then you get a new set of abilities. This is one of my favorite aspects of Maplestory and it really makes it unique. The player base in Maplestory is also awesome, everyone on here is extremely nice and it can be really fun to just talk to other players rather than grind. There are many other things for you to do besides grind of course; You can do "dungeons" where you are sent to a certain area for 10-15 levels and do quests for the NPCs there and have a lot of fun learning the lore, you can also fight massive bosses with other players (this is much like a raid in WoW). There are so many fun things to do in Maplestory which is why I have played the game for so long and will continue to do so.

content:
2, 2014
												i have played this game since i was little despite what steam says, i have only had steam for less than a year. i have put countless hours into this game and absolutely say this game is pay to win. ignore everyone else who says this game is now pay to win, this game is very much pay to win. without paying you wont make it far at all in the game. without money you wont be able to make meso (the ingame currency) to support yourself with equips and weapons. not only do you need money to get the equips but these equips BARELY allow you to deal with enemies that are your lvl and still leave you lacking. early on in the game you will find that just to fight certain bosses you will need to be funded or rely on other who ARE funded. not only this but the entire free market is run by people who are funded and are selling items that drop from bosses you can only defeat with tons of funding. one certain area, root abyss, to defeat one boss you need a party of highly funded players just to defeat it despite the lvl req is 180 you will need to do atleast 4m damage per line if you wish to attempt it with a party or 15m if you want to attempt soloing. not only do you need to fund yourself but its a gamble in itself. the main way to use your money to adavance in the game besides buying the equips needed it improving your equips. without improving your equips, your equips STILL wont get you far into the game. the way to improve your equips is by buying an item from the cash shop called "cubes". in current maplestory, as of 7/22/14, there are red cubes and black cubes (black cubes cost more yet yeild an apparent greater chance of improvement). basically items have a potential which means the items have a chance to provide bonus stats. there are 4 tiers of potential: rare, epic, unique, and legendary. as the tier progresses, the bonuses become more usefull but only if the stats if provides are actually meant for your class. not only does this in itself make it a gamble but the chance of getting your own stat is pretty low. aside from that the rate to upgrade a teir is EXTREMELY LOW meaning you will have to pay more to get that low chance of an increased teir. this same "money whoring" cube system is also used for "bonus potentials" which is the same thing but just more rare to find an item that yeilds bonus potential (more money for nexon if you want to improve bonus potential too). aside from cubing you can also try scrolling items but as you would expect, the only decent scrolls only have a chance of working meaning if it fails, itll take up one slot of however many your equips has meaning the items max stat potential is decreased. not only do these scrolls have a chance of failure but some of these scrolls even have a chance to destory your item if it happens to fail, and the only way to protect your item if you wish to risk one of these scrolls (which are typically the best) is to buy a "guardian scroll" which is again, in the cash shop for a moderately high price.without any of this above, making it through the game will be extremely difficult, or even impossible. at certain points early in the game, bosses even become impossible to defeat without funding. this doesnt stop at bosses though, about halfway through the game it becomes too difficult to even defeat the enemies needed to train and level up.whether you take my word for it or not, if you want to try the game feel free to, it is a  free to download game afterall.

												I cannot fully explain how frustrating it is how Nexon destroyed this game. I used to play this game as a kid for hours. This game used to be perfect with a very large community, awesome party quests, easy and comfortable controls, awesome class balance, people spending hundreds of dollars on NX, and a community of Maple videos. The awesome video makers from dray86 to greencream to goldentot. I used to even make some of these maple videos. You can check them out at youtube/NaBeHobby.It was paradise if you loved mmo rpgs where you can easily make friends and have tons of fun for hours. People were having in game relationship and marriages for the love of God. This game was, in my opinion, by far a better game than WoW until... They completely ruined it after the Big Bang Patch. Everything is simplified, new classes overpower the older classes, people leaving the community, and devs only care about your money.This game used to be a 10/10 game for me. I used to spend hours and hours everyday throughout my middleschool and halfway highschool. Now it's 2/10. It's very frustrating when my most favorite game turns out crappy because the devs were corrupted with greed. I can only hope Star Citizen will be able to replace this for me.I will miss you, Maplestory. You were that hot girl that I had a crush on, were going out, but then cheated on me. You broke my heart. How could you. I will always remember the times we spent together.

												I put a lot of hours into this game, it is very unique in that it's a 2D sidescroller MMO. In this review, it appears that I have less than an hour clocked in; this is due to the fact that you are locked into creating a Steam account and cannot log into an existing one. What a drawback. I really enjoyed the wide selection of classes that were available, but at one point, Maplestory only started adding classes for account-buffs or to attract returning players. The entire market is basical broken on a regular basis, and hackers commonly plauge popular maps. Hell, even I hacked to see how easy it was. Despite the boost that insta-teleporting, auto-macros, and godmode gave, the entire game was still just a slow grind to the next level. After that it's all about the equipment. For what though? Don't get me wrong, I loved this game for the longest time and I wish I could find that pleasure in it again, but Nexon has turned this game into a cash-cow, claiming 'free-to-play' in their advertisements. Trust me when I say it's free-to-start, pay-to-compete, hack-to-play, quit-to-win.

content:
0, 2014
												This was one of the very first games I played to experience extreme power creep. Every few months, a new class is released, or an old one is comletely reworked to be stronger. 90% of the time this new/reworked class is the most powerful thing in the entire game and you see ~50% of the community playing it. This cycle repeats itself as every class is made stronger and stronger until the monsters of the game need to be buffed to compensate. There's also the horrendously pay-to-win microtransactions that make the power-curve between "funded" characters and "unfunded" completely incomparable. Maplestory is long dead. Move along.

content:
0, 2015
												tl;dr- no.Maplestory has changed a lot over its ten year career, but at its core it is still a complete and utter grindfest. Though the time it takes to get to an acceptable level to really explore the content that the game offers has been shortened, it still feels extremely long and drawn out. And even if you end up actually making it to this level you reach a point where getting gear overtakes leveling in priority, the cost of acquring entry level gear for fighting some mid difficulty bosses becomes pretty high. At this point is where the game really blossoms. There is a rather decentvariety of bosses and encounters, and are often rewarding and create a cool sense of progression and challenge. But, after this point is where the fatal flaw of the game lies. You reach a point where the only way to  progress is invest a major amount of money into gear, larger than many other f2p games. Aside from that, still a fun game, but lacks the same charm and community it had when it came out.+ Gives a great sense of character progression+ Many varied classes to choose from + Nostalgic+ Mushrooms+ Still addictive - Pay2win- Devs and customer support don't really care about their players just that sweet $- Huge amount of time needed to reach an endgame level (even for an MMO)- Lacks the same sense level of community it had in its earlier age- Gigantic gap between funded and unfunded players- Some Classes just don't have an even remotely competitive level of DPS- Even an equipment slot that holds stats is gated by a pay barrier- An Incredible amount of botters- After quitting there is a 100% chance of asking "Why did i do this to myself"

content:
8, 2014
												Don't let my 12 hours fool you. I have played for a VERY long time. This game used to be fun. I remember spending HOURS grinding (which was FUN! Fun grinding. I KNOW!) and leveling my character. I remember how hard it was to chhose between the classes. They were each fun and awesome. Then everything changed when Aran was introduced. HOLY ♥♥♥♥. Some of my fondest memories of all the games I've ever played come from the experience of swinging a giant pole-axe around and wrecking face. But it was hard as ♥♥♥♥ to level. And I loved every minute. But I slowly got older. I stopped logging in as often. Why? New classes. The freaking new classes. The little ♥♥♥♥ of a dragon wizard was the last straw. I couldn't take it. What had they done to my beautiful game?Then, to blow my fondness and love for this game into tinier shards, BOOM! BIG BANG! (Man, ♥♥♥♥ big bang.)Changing the entie world? What idiot that that would be a good idea? Whatever. It can't be that bad! So, I decided to start playing again, and I realised something horrible in the first couple hours! HOURS! My lovely, cute, AMAZING game had been corrupted. With power creep. SO. MUCH. POWER CREEP. (If you don't know what that is, search it up.) Like come on! I got to level 80 (80!!!) with SO much ease. It sickened me. What had happened? What made it this way? Oh right. Money makes the world go 'round eh?I love this game. But it is a bittersweet love. I hate what it has become. I love it for the friends, memories, and good times it's given me. But I hate it for not telling me it was going to change, so I could play just a little more, cherish it a little harder. It's hard to find good MMOs nowadays. This is... WAS a shining example of a good MMO. Now, it is a glammed up, shiny, flashy carcass. A shell of a once amazing game. No. Not a game, but a masterpiece, because everytime I look at this game, I remember a happy time. And everytime I look at this game, a sadness for what once was creeps into my heart.♥♥♥♥ you, Maplestory. You beautiful son of a ♥♥♥♥♥.

content:
5, 2016
												I used to play Maplestory around 2005 while in highschool, and to me it was extremely difficult to get to level 120 as a Bowmaster. Every couple months since 2006 I wanted to play the game as a game I could sink some hours into just to get the grind out of my system, but due to compatability issues, I could never ever return to the game unless I went through these ridiculous changes to my OS and when I did, the game was so different and I felt I missed so much and the learning curve was so drastic at the point of where I was that I simply was dettered from rejoining the game, so my Maplestory experience so far ended there.Fast forward to 2015, I find out that Maplestory is now accessible through Steam. So I decided to do a little research and see if I could pull up my old account and start up my Bowmaster and just be higher average in the game. I get my archer back, but man EVERYTHING is different, but in a good way.Game was much easier to get into, the learning curve and leveling process was MUCH easier, there were a lot of classes to choose from, all with their own style of gameplay and storyline, and each as good as the last.Pros:- Easy learning curve- Every class is good and visually pleasing- Big numbers are oddly satisfying which there's plenty of- Grind Heavy, but time will fly easilyCons:- Grind Heavy- There are certain parts of the game where you can get experience bottlenecked for certain classes- The social aspect of the game is near none, so it's very hard to get a group or make ANY friends at all- Some microtransactions are neccessary to get min/max unless you play for a LONG time********TL;DR********Easy learning curve, a lot of classes to choose from and each one is as good as the last. Big numbers everywhere, but very grind intensive. Be prepared to play this game alone, as there's no socialness here.

content:
9, 2014
												MapleStory is basically my childhood; I played it alot in Middle School, alot in High School and even some in college.  I spent two years getting to level 70 on a Page, which was one of the harder, boring classes to play back then.  It felt awesome getting to White Knight status (being probably the only one running around) after two whole years of grinding and socializing in-game.  Then, almost over-night, it all became for nothing.  The White Knight became seriously overpowered, the levelling system went from taking two years to two weeks to two days to get higher levels, and everything I knew and thought I had worked for became almost worthless.  The point is, this game changes really quickly (as MMOs should to survive).  The tactics I had painstakingly learned became obsolete, as had my dedication to being unique in the game.  The reason I can't recommend this game is simply because it's very polarizing in structure: either you're dedicated to playing full-time, or you're not.

content:
er 10, 2015
												I've played Maplestory for 10+ years. I've recently decided to use Steam for it.To break it down, Maplestory is a fun game, provided you have a good reason to start and to continue playing. It helps with the fact that the game has constant events and promotions. But even more important than that is to have friends to play with. Like every other game, without friends, Maplestory becomes a bit dull.I originally fell in love with the game because I absolutely loved the fact that there were so many places to explore, so many hidden areas, and so many things to do, accomplish, and to figure out. I played pre-Big Bang update (Shoutout to players who played around that time xD), where leveling up used to be an accomplishment. Now, levels (at least early on) are given practically for free. With 2XP events going on all the time, and various different things that boost that even further like Cash Shop items, Maplestory ceased to become the thing I first fell in love with. But eventually, they added the new level range 201-250, and then I took that and started playing the game again. It had the same frustratingly difficult level system like before, but it was nostalgic.Maplestory is a nostalgic RPG game, still having most of its former charm, and it continues to draw in many players. Though many Steam players do not play the game because people on Steam are mostly there for the large online community of FPS games and the like, it's still an amazing game. I recommend it 100%, provided that you have the continuous motivation of playing the game.This game is a rather special game. The first of its genre (a Korean MMORPG), Maplestory was and still is amazing. I believe that Maplestory is a rather impressive game that has the potential to do much more amazing if they just made the game more multiplayer themed. As of now, all you can do is farming and party quests together. Though they did have the occasional PVP thing going on, the way Maplestory is set up makes that rather difficult. If they can find a successful way to integrate that or make more ways to play together, then this game would be the successful game in North America it is in South Korea.Oh, as courtesy, here's the summarizationTL; DR: Farming Simulator for over a decade, enjoyable with friends

												2 years ago MapleStory was fun and easy to play, where you can easily reach to 170+ or the level cap (200), but at 2014 all of that changed, resulting many maplers to quit even with new updates, all training maps has been significantly nerf making it hard to reach the level you want, however this game offers many different classes to play and try. In MapleStory there are many servers (over 10 servers to choose from), but a majority of the servers contains unfriendly community and tends to lag a lot. I would recommend this game to those who are willing to play more than a year, but overall if you play for a few weeks you will quit. Not only that MapleStory contains a lot of hackers and the the company, Nexon tends to get DDoS attacks (at least once per month), this will affect a lot of games including Combat Arms and Mabinogi, which will cause massive lag and disconnection. Play at your on risk and avoid flamming and raging.

er 12, 2014
												Increadibly addiciting, but sadly due to a recent update I no longer reccomend this game. My reasons are this:Way back when, when the game was still new my sister showed me this game. I installed it and started to play. got to level 20 and had a bunch off goodies. Then something happened to where the game was unplayable. So I stopped playing.Now then, the second time around I saw it on steam, Thinking back to the fun I did have with it, I decided to give it a shot. Got all the way to level 30 and have good enough gear and items, knocking out quests left and right. Till a recent update to where the game does not launch through steam anymore. It goes to a black screen then remains running in the background but does not play. Unacceptable in my book considering this game was made long ago. The bugs should have been ironed by now. Once I am able to get back in game and be able to play without fail, I will take this down. But for now I do not recommend MapleStory for Steam Users.

content:
er 2, 2013
												Before it came out on Steam, I remember playing Maplestory with only 4 classes. Warrior, Mage, Bowman, and Thief. Over the years Maplestory has evolved into something almost completely different. Some old players have given it up because the game has grown at a rate that rivals other popular MMORPG's like World of Warcraft. The main draw of this game is cooperation. Without friends by your side, the climb to become the most powerful mapler in the land and the challenge of defeating the Black Mage, who has inflicted chaos on the Maple World is a very long one. Luckily the game doesn't require much to run and it's even easier to make friends on your first day of playing. I've met 5 people myself who I owe my well being to. They made me who I am today. Now what's different about this game? What makes it stand out? The art style. Today, 2-D MMO's have either died out, become obscure with about 500 players playing a day, and/or become a 2-D 3-D hybrid. Maplestory is one of a kind where you can compare it to those days of playing Megaman on your NES. 100% Sidescrolling, Shoot em' up, Beat em' up, RPG, Multi-Event, Party Questing, Adventure that anyone can get into. So what are the cons? Every MMO has 1 or 2. What's wrong with this game? Well, you remember how I said this game relies heavily on community? Unfortunately, the community has become more secluded/hostile than it used to be. Pre-BigBang you could jump on a ship that goes to Orbis and meet up with some of the most powerful players in the game or the weakest and have friendly conversations with them for about 20 mins until you arrive at your destination. Today, Maplestory has become elitist. So unless you come in with friends or decide to take a weak player under your wing it's a bit more challenging to make strong relations here. Speaking of relations beware of Gender Bender players. Quite a few players choose excessively appealing avatars to swindle money and items from people of the opposite sex through marriage. Yes, this game has marriage. Always a juicy source of gossip in the maple world, marrying someone who divorced a top player is practically the same as being a top player.Overall, Maplestory is an amazing game that not only has an entertaining storyline, but also has some of the most addicting RPG gameplay to date. Despite what many people say, unless they put in their first 8 hours the review typically isn't worth it. Give it a try! Play for 2 hours and watch your time fly away!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
r 8, 2015
												After logging quite a few hours into this game over the years I figured it was about time I wrote a review. The game is fun but there's a LOT of grinding. Not like world of warcraft grinding where the quests are all different. Maplestory is go to this place, kill X amount of these, and repeat for every quest in the game. Once you get to a high enough level boss fights are pretty fun but that's after grinding up to that level. Party quests are fun to do though. It makes the incessant grinding a lot more bearable.The loot system is pretty basic where all the enemy's stuff gets thrown to the floor and you run over it button mashing to pick it all up. That gets kinda old after a while but luckily there's pets that pick up the loot for you! That you have to pay for... Gotta make money somehow I guess?One of the charms Maplestory has is the platforming. There's a few quests where you parkour around to get to the next one. Those were always enjoyable (if infuriating at times) and a nice breather from the grinding.Overall Maplestory is a pretty basic game. Kill this, get experience, level up to get new skills so you can keep grinding. It's more of a game you play if you have a summer with nothing really else to do. It's not the best game but it's not the worst either. The events were always really fun though and one of the reasons I keep revisiting this game. So yes, recommended if you have a lot of time to kill.

er 8, 2016
												To get to anywhere in Maple. 1. be in a town that has a quick move and allows you to go to dimension portal go to the town known as momijigaoka. from there ( if you are over lvl 50) go to the dimension portal again and go to the Party Quest area. Leave that map. when you come back out you should be in Mushroom Shrine. Find the Green Rock and it will allow you to go to Henesys. From there quick move to the Ship icon. Go down the ladder. Go up the rope until you find the interdimensional Portal in Pantheon. Click that and from there you can go to any town in Maple World.PS if you are under lvl 50, first purchase a nearest town scroll in the shop once that is done go to the right in  Momijigaoka until you find the map with cherry blossom trees. then use the nearest town scroll. this will take you to the mushroom shrine. PSS. After you leave the Party Quest area, you will be in ch 1.

content:
ber 6, 2015
												For the lazy people.Pros:- Vast world with thousand of quests, mobs, bosses, events and more to come.- Weekly update with new events, items and more.- Great diversity of classes.- Millions of character customization.- Insanely big community.- Unique graphic and music and it's own sense of humour.- Large of daily events and bosses that will keep you engaged with the game.Cons:- Large amount of grinding.- Pay to grind less.- Pay to get extra cosmetics. Neutral:- Contains ranking system.- Max level of 250.- 17 worlds with 3 world alliances and 3 stand-alone worlds.For people that want a more in-depth review.Maplestory has always and will always be a treasured baby of Nexon. The developers have implimented a lot of interesting events, bosses and mobs into the game. As of recent updates, Maplestory have come in contact with 2 huge anime series, Sword Art Online and Attack on Titan. These have been 2 of the biggest events in Maplestory. It's large community astonishes many people on just how great the game can be. And the large amount of diversity in the game just adds icing onto an already beautiful cake.Though this cake might not be like be everyone, as grinding is one of the core elements of the game. The game consists of hours of grinding mobs for exp, mesos (currency in-game) and rare drops. But these grinding will be reduced greatly as you level gets higher as you'll be going into the stage of bossing to gain more mesos, and leveling once you've hit the 200 mark will just not be as engaging.This game is not pay-to-win, this will be a statement that I am willing to make. This game if more pay-to-grind-less-or-just-have-hours-of-grinding-if-you-don't-want-to-pay kind of game.The majority of your cash is mainly to get cosmetic items that will make your character look very fancy. The minority of your cash will go to items that will enhance your gear, which you can get by grinding of buying it off others.Alas, this game at its core has achieved what the developers have wanted to achieve and it is not likely to change too much from the state that it is right now.

content:
y 18, 2014
												TL;DR version:Pros+Okay graphics+Okay gameplayCons-Difficulty is minimal and the game is laughably easy-Long and drawn-out tutorials that are poorly integrated with plot.-Combat is essentially Slow-Time-Events-Dull and uninteresting plot.4/10I was really kind of sad coming back to this. As a mapler from a long time ago who was stuck at my second job, nothing feels like a challenge anymore. The skills are inconsistently changing and annoying, and overall my character feels either too powerful or too weak. There isn't a "just-right" tier for me, it seems, and I'm only at level 60. I really used to enjoy Maplestory, but now it's changed to the point of "Who are half of these classes?" In fact I remember when the Cygnus Knights came out; that was an interesting character class, compared to the other classes that are essentially all plot-driven for reasons that I could truly care less about.An example of this is the new and seemingly more interesting classes. I can't remember the specific names because, as stated, I could really care less, but one of the plots was that this fellow seemed to have a bond with the Empress and it involved teddy bears as well as some sort of accusation and revelation of evil chums...? Something bad happens and aforementioned fellow is injured for some reason. I enjoy the inclusion of plot in tutorials, but I also enjoy brevity. Most plot cutscenes were completely irrelevant to the tutorial which is exactly WHY I didn't care; because it wasn't teaching me anything impotrant that was integrated into my current objective or learning how to play as my character.Another problem is the fact that this game has done what I believe quite a few other video games have done; stooped too low to helping out new players. The game feels pathetically easy and there's no real motivation for me to continue playing the game... All in all, it's a bit like an old friend that you see after five years and it turns out they're almost like a stranger to you. Goodbye Maplestory.

content:
ry 24, 2015
												This game till this day is the best 2D side scroller RPG. That being said...When this game came out it was incredible, I was quickly addicted and like most RPG players I played on and off mostly during the summer. I loved the character sprites, the anime/chibi theme. The 2D  aspect was done really well, navigation was easy, combat was entertaining, and the frustrating platforming jump quests were proof that even moving could be mastered. Back in Maplestory's hayday Bosses took hours to do and were seldom done. People cared about guild leader boards, the game broke up grinding with enjoyable party quests, basically minigames but with a nice EXP reward. Maplestory also had a great social environment, not typically your hardcore game types but people of all kinds had an easy time finding a guild and friends.The elephant in the room....This game has many flaws, but i'm just addressing the two that KILLED the game.What killed this game is the horrific cash shop and formally MTS, even more than rampant hackers. For a long time now the cash shop has been sucking players dry with ridiculously priced non permanent stuff. You will pay up to $10 for a single piece of rental clothing. It gets worse, with the addition of cubes, Meso sacks and some necessary conveniences(pets, scissors of karma etc) Its a pay-to-win mess. Its impossible to play this without spending money at some point, or else you'd be wasting your time now that is so grindy. This is the WORSE implementations of micro transactions in a game i've ever seen. Its completely unacceptable. Nexon does not care about its customers. Maple is showing its age and what made it great is rapidly dying. Hackers are a big issue too. But At this point I can hardly blame them since its so hard to progress without real world money.If you want to play Maplestory, Go on a private server. Its still a good game, Nexon is not a good company. Worse than EA.

content:
er 31, 2014
												I saw the trailers, the "mostly positive" reviews, and the cool trailers, and was expecting a simple, fun, casual game to play with my friends. Instead, the tutorial treated me to a forced stealth mission, which was probably the ♥♥♥♥♥iest "stealth" I've ever seen in a video game. After a few times of getting inevitably cased on the large, flat, open platforums with guards just walking back and forth, the game just teleported me past them. Later, in my fancy airship house, I had the worst time trying to navigate up the wierd 2D staircases and such. My screen was flooded with a million menus, all of which were rather un-responsive to trying to close out of them. Then I got my first "real" quest: kill mushrooms. My options: 1: a really slow and low-damage poke, 2: some move that sounded complicated and I never even used. 3: a jump-dash that did damage, but was super hard to aim and usually does more damage to me than the enemies, or 4: a double-slash on a large crowd of enemies that killed most of them instantly. Basicly, the whole fight was running up to mushrooms and pushing the "kill them" button. And it wasn't fun to do cool combos, cause my other moves sucked and the mushrooms dropped a ton of mana potions, and the move didn't even cost that much mana. Later, I got lost (like as soon as the game stopped railroading me) and found two areas full of enemies way stronger than me who just insta-killed me. Finally found one of those odd menus with way more stuff than I needed, but this one had a "teleport to places you don't even know what/where they are," and I chose the mushroom one because it was the first one, and killing mushrooms sounded like a new-player thing to do. Found another quest: kill more mushrooms. While looking through my stats, I noticed that for leveling up, they had a convenient button of "auto-assign points." This sounded good to me: it would probably have some cool algorithm to balance strength, dex, and int, while still prioritizing luck (my class' main attribute). Nope, it wanted to dump every point into luck. I also noticed that after another one of my quests, "drink instant-level potion" I still had the potion in my inventory. I used it about 6 more times or so before it dissappeared, which could be either due to durability (which was not listed anywhere in its description) or a glitch. In short, the only thing I could really grasp about the game was "kill mushrooms," which, as great fun as that is, doesn't make a game. Despite the "massive multiplayer" part of it, I didn't see a single other person on. My friend was trying it out too and we planned to meet up, but his game crashed, had trouble loading, and stopped itself because it "detected cheating" (and no, he wasn't cheating). I really wasn't expecting to be blown off my feet, but when your menus are more difficult than your enemies, then you're doing something VERY wrong.

												I have been a mapler since about the time this game launched. The graphics are pretty good, there's excellent custimization, and as of late, there's a LOT more choices for classes. This makes the game a lot more fun and interesting to have multiple takes of the same general class. (EG - Mechanic Vs Pirate Vs Angelic Buster) The game has also become less party quest based (although PQ's are still fun and helpful), which is nice considering the game used to be almost based on this. There's new engaging story quests, and MapleStory as a whole has grown a lot since the original launch date. I hope Nexon keeps up with the awesome content for Maple, as this will always be my go-to game when I'm bored of everything else.Also, nexon, PLEASE fix the one-time account link. It should not be a one-time deal. I don't like that I have to keep a standalone launcher instead of just being able to launch through steam.

content:
18, 2014
												I played this game from 2006-2013.  I have thousands and thousands of hours on this game.  The 200-ish hours that are logged with Steam is the winter break of 2012-13 I spent with nothing better to do.Here's the sum of it.Do you enjoy spending hours and hours killing the same enemies at the same place just to gain a level?Do you enjoy doing quests whose effort to reward ratio is even worse than the method mentioned above?Do you enjoy playing games where the majority of the (dwindling) community is under the age of 18?Do you enjoy games where the only thing that matters is DPS?Do you enjoy paying to win?If you answered "Yes!" to one or more of these questions, then you have every right to download and play this game.For everyone else, you're better off trying something else.Now you might be saying to yourself, "I'm sure there is more to this game than that."Nexon tries their best to add new content (which is either a mechanic that will be exploited to death or a new class that breaks the game) and apply balances (removing said mechanics and nerfing said classes).However, what hasn't change through the 8 years that I've spent on this game are the questions I asked you above.Are you familiar with the classic board game, Monopoly?Maybe you and some friends are hanging out one day with nothing to do, and one friend mentions a cool new version that has come out recently.  Being it that you're on an extended vacation with time to kill, you think to yourself, "We've been down this road before.  We're probably gonna start up the game, sit down, roll the first pair of die, and instantly regret doing this.  But I'm feeling optimistic.  Maybe this time will be different."  You turn to your friends and say, "I'm down if you're down."  So you and your friends start up the game and you're starting to get really into it, but a few turns later your friends are already sick of it and you immediately regret being so optimistic about this whole idea.Maplestory is exactly like that.

content:
, 2014
												Pros:+Interesting World+Cute Cartoonish Graphics+Great CommunityCons:-Monotonous Gameplay-A bit P2W-Tons of Hackers that don't really affect gameplay, but are still there.I've been playing this game since 2008 and I'm currently enjoying it. It's a game where you can find enjoyment in almost anything, really. Don't like leveling up and having competition in areas to level up? Just hang out in main citys and talk with people to make friends, I'm sure you'll find some. The game can get fairly monotonous at times, if you're looking to ACTUALLY play it instead of hanging out with friends. I play this game on, and off, sometimes I hate it, sometimes I love it, and currently, it's good. It can seem p2w with some cash items being able to net you 200 million in game currency for 3 dollars. The graphics are cute, the community is pretty good, the world is full of life and is interesting... and hackers are there, but they usually get banned instantly and permantly.Conclusion: If you've played this game before (2008 - 2012) you may or may not enjoy it... it's all up to you to make the descision of downloading the game and trying it out.8/10

er 30, 2016
												Simple: Play with friends, Yes! Play alone, No!Having both good and bad memories of this game in the past I'm surprised to see it now on steam.I can't say it's the worst game or the best but I do still enjoy the designs and artwork, having it's little comedy into the action and the sound is what I feel is the core source that many other MMORPG's has taken influence from. Still what made it bad would be the  toxic community of very sensually active preteens seeking love relationships and harsh judgement from everyone for simple mistakes. It's like high school all over again!Would I recommend it? I have to say 50-50 on that because it sure is nice for being an old free MMORPG that still updates and make new changes but it's been years and I feel like no matter how much it tries to change it will be dull compared to other MMORPGs. There are better ones out there... But if you choose to play with friends then nothing could really go wrong!( From a personal experience to reason my hate for NEXON though is because I used to play back in 2007-2008 when it was still GLOBAL but later forced me into EUROPE region servers and seperated me from my friends as well as making me lose my hardworking character. I was still so young and that really depressed me. :/  )

r 13, 2014
												I've been playing for seven years so this might be a bit biased, but I personally enjoy the game. The animations are nice to look at, I enjoy the music, there is still a decent player base(at least on the server I play on), and it's kind of fun just creating your own training routes and seeing how fast you can level up.The events they give can also be fun, even if Korea gets them 6 months ahead of us.Though there are some cons as well, Kind of "childish" graphicsSome may like it while others will be turned off.PlatformingOne of the worst thigns in the game is the amount of platforming, I honestly refuse to play any part with platformign since it pisses me off.DeadspotsSome level sections have a deadspot where there are few training options and you'll usually level up slowly. Though through all that I find the game to be very above average, so I'd give it a 7/10. Which is higher then I give most games. Well over 2000 hours on the game in total, and I'm on and off every couple weeks.

												                                Ghostbusters                                     by                                Harold Ramis                                    and                                Dan Aykroyd                           Final Shooting Script                       Last revised October 7, 1983                                                        FADE INEXT. NEW YORK PUBLIC LIBRARY -- DAYThe sun shines brightly on the classic facade of the main library at FifthAvenue and 42nd Street.  In the adjacent park area, pretty hustlers anddrug peddlers go about their business.FRONT STEPSA few people lounge on the steps flanked by the familiar stone lions.INT. MAIN READING ROOM -- DAYPeople are dotted throughout the room sitting at the long oak tablespolished by decades of use.  Reading lamps with green glass shades cast agolden glow on the tables.  The patina of age is everywhere.  It is veryquiet.LIBRARIANA slightly stout, studious looking girl in her late twenties circulatesquietly among the tables picking up books and putting them on her cart.Everything seems completely normal and peaceful.POVA single eerie musical note signals the presence of something strangelooking down on the Librarian from a vantage point high above the room.It follows the Librarian as she pushes her cart around the corner.INT. WORK AREAThe Librarian is alone in a back room sorting books for reshelving.Behind her is the card catalogue.  One of the books attracts her interestand she starts leafing through it.THE CARD CATALOGUEAnother eerie note is heard as one of the drawers silently slides openbehind the Librarian and hundreds of index cards start popping out.  TheLibrarian continues reading completely oblivious to this strangephenomenon.She gets up and moves past another row of cabinets.  Two more drawersquietly slide open, and thousands of file cards start shooting out of theopen drawers just behind her, but the Librarian still doesn't notice.THE STACKSThe Librarian works her way through rows and rows of old iron shelvescontaining many thousands of volumes stacked from floor to ceiling.  Asshe puts the books back in their proper places, she slowly gets thefeeling that she's being watched.  She continues her task but suddenlyhears a scratching noise and stops.                                LIBRARIAN                        (puzzled)                Hello?  Is anybody there?A ROW OF BOOKSAs the Librarian walks down the aisle, books start shooting off the shelfbehind her.  She turns suddenly and sees the fallen books.THE LIBRARIANFrightened now, she walks slowly to the end of the aisle and tentativelypeeks around the corner.  Seeing no one, she starts to scratch her headand suddenly a dozen books fly off the shelf right in front of her andfall to the floor.                                LIBRARIAN                        (frightened)                All right!  Who's there?  Lyle? Is that you?Very slowly now, her heart pounding, the Librarian tiptoes to the otherend of the aisle.  She gets to the corner and starts to peek around it,afraid to look but unable to resist.INT. THE NEXT AISLE -- DAYThe Librarian comes slowly around the end of the stacks and gets her firstlook at the thing that's been watching her.  Her eyes go very wide and hermouth opens in horror. She screams.

content:
18, 2015
												I don't know about my opinion policy, but there is something with me with liking actual mixed/controversal games.Its play this game for a long time, take a break.Try it again after 3 months and then play it for a long time again... Repeat.Being a person who has not spent a single penny on this game, I still probably found fun in this game. Possibly just because I like wasting my time because I have barely any games to play, and still at least have some satisfaction included.I'll go with some pros with the game.First is the graphic design... It has a unique appeal to it while giving itself a charm. Even the most evilest looking of all enemies look clean.From the attacks, there is a lot of "WHOA HOLY CRAP THIS LOOKS SO AWESOME!!!" ones cosmetically, while at times practically.Most of the notable characters in the present main story are pretty original. Cygnus, Neinhart, Orchid, and so on.and As part of the story, the clans within it are quite official feeling, the Black Wings, the Cygnus Knights... The black wings especially due to the amount of backstory with their characters.And now... the cons.As most of the people know, yes, this is a freemium game by all means. Making the game's experience the more fun using actual funds. As for the same time, there were a lot of freemium items I found that only had a 90 day trial.It is like valve making a system where you pay $30 to have a certain unusual for a temporary amount of time, Except less attention instead.The playerbase is 95% of people at the age of >13, the first time I encountered someone who chat with me and requested to play together, I denied the request in the most polite way I could think of saying... All he said was "*********" after that, and that is the only time I actually talked to someone out of the hours I played with this game.Also the amount of times I've seen someone who wants to get married using the shout system.Quests in a nutshell:FIND ME 150 OF THIS AND THAT EACH AND I'LL GIVE YOU SOME EXP!!!!Find me something that is almost impossible to do until you level up 50 more times.'I need you to hunt the monsters till they drop something, the programmers made it very lucky to find.and Classes are unbalanced that it felt like it was measured using kilometre rulers, and thought a 1Km difference didn't mind much. After playing the Evan class for a while, he started to lack power, tried out the revamped mechanic class and it was much more powerful.Overall, I give this game a rating sentence of...Very mixed, but finding fun without pay to win stuff is a likely chance with the right mindset.

content:
y 1, 2014
												Maplestory is a 2D MMORPG(massive multiplayer online role playing game). While the graphics are dated they are still appealing. The pros: -Pracitcally a single player game     -Free to play     -Multiple classes, +15 The cons:     -+15 classes: there are so many classes that many of the classes fit the same style of character.      -Monotonous: this game is the epitome of a grind fest. You grind for levels by hunting montsers from levels 10-250.        The quests given are typical MMO quests. The game is such a grind fest that when grinding a map if someone other than        you joins the map, people throw tantrums and get upset.     -No socialization: ever since the big bang update socialization was drastically hit. The bigbang update brought forth a          massive increase in the exp rate, only further supporting the grind fest.     -Nexons idea of balance: when the release new classes their idea of marketing the new class is to make the class stronger       the class before them. They repeat that cycle until the older classes get to far behind, so they have to bring the older        classes back to up par. Rinse and repeat that cylce.Another thing to bring the relation between Nexon and the community was terrible for a large period of time, no commmunication tickets going unanswered for weeks/months. The last several monthes something changed and Nexon is currently attempting to repair the damage they caused.

, 2015
												This game has taken many leaps foreward and backward up until this point, and ultimately in the end I would say that the game is throughly enjoyable. However, if you want to hit the damage cap and really be the best, the game is 100% pay to win. Without paying you cannot even see the top. Another factor about this game that i would critisize is that nexon has dropped the idea of roles for bosses. You dont need a healer to defeat a boss, which means that parties don't use any teamwork. With that said, i do enjoy checking back into the game every once in a while, and theres SOO many classes! all in all fun game but pay 2 win :3

												Played since Beta... Wether it be a pet, exp gains, or even a shop. You'll need to buy one of those 2 things to proceed to get to that "level" where all the kids with mommy's credit card are at. (Even if you have your own job you fall in this category by spending those insane amounts on this... game that will one day shut down) I'd still check it out if you enjoy Action 2D side scrollers, it can still be fun without paying anything.. Just frustrating.

content:
er 26, 2014
												This game was really good, and I loved it more than sleep for a very long time. Eventually, I started hating all the changes but kept coming back. Once I finished high school I quit because my college blocked the game. I came back to play for a while one summer when i found it on steam, but found myself bored since all my friends had quit playing. I have no doubt that I was addicted to this game in high school. The changes were okay at first, but then they became frequent and way too crazy. I was okay with a few simple changes, even when they added a new class. Then they started adding a new character every 5 minutes and it became hard to keep up with the game or the economy in it. Go on vacation with your family for a week and some of your most valuable items are worthless because a new update had a new boss which gave it out like candy.It's your typical mmorpg grindfest, and there's very little appreciation for a newcomer in older worlds... although they will complain that the server is too empty 2 minutes after making fun of someone for not knowing where the next quest is or whatever "noob" question they asked. I joined the game because of a friend, but then I kept playing because of the community, now I would I avoid it because of the community. I enjoyed playing for probably the first half of my time. Most of the second half I tried convining myself it was going to be fun again, and tried finding new people to play with. I thought it would be better once it came to steam but it didn't really help. Eventually I just stopped, and started playing other games.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 4, 2015
												Some background at the bottom, clear cut facts here:  Pros:    - Unique.    - Free.    - Highly social.    - Virtually endless amount of story line to follow, I've been playing 10 years and I have not even completed half of it.    - Not a game you need to play every day, you can drop it for a few months and pick it back up no problem.    - Everything you can pay for, can be obtained through (sometimes tireless) ingame efforts. I did not pay for nx for the first five years.    - Consistantly updated, always being worked on.    - Great bug support, I have contacted them about obscure bugs before and (when they were at fault for it) they had a fix for it within the day, I call that response time. Like, for a MMO: fixing a obscure bug (flight with my classes mount) within the DAY has got to be the fastest MMORPG response time I have ever seen.    - Although it has a light overtone, it is actually quite a dark and graphic game. If you actually read the story line, the things that go on are quite morbid and macabre. It is not nessesarily a childs game.     - I see A LOT of older players on, the fact of the matter is that the younger demographic does not tend to interact with the community. The usual demographic for the social towns are around 16-30. Although there are many young players, they don't tend to be as prominant.    - The community, I mean.. Come on guys, It's maplestory! I have NEVER played a more social MMORPG, EVER. This game not only has a massive community, but I would say you are unlikely to run into some nasty people. It is largely populated by nice people! I mean, yeah. You will run into some nasty people, but that's the same for everything. I am a massive collector of chairs, and when I sell them, I spend about twenty minutes with a mercher on each chair to tell them about how I got it and what it meant to me. One of them said that they were literally crying and that I made him really nostalgic about the game.     - The story, It is beautiful. Not only is there a pratically endless suply of it, it is quality content. Their newest update black heaven literally made me cry. It was SO intense, I can not listen to the ending credits song without a tear rolling down my cheek. I can't tell you how amazing it is. My absolute favourite character to play is the Evan, it ties SO nicely with the other story lines. It ties seamlessly with Silent Crusade, Black Heaven, Glowing Sylph, and so much more. It is really deep and meaningful to me.    - I could go on, and on, and on. Just download it for Goddess of time's sake.   Cons:    - It is a grinding game, I would put this on my pro's list but a lot of people don't like this. It is a korean based MMO, it is the standard. Just walk in knowing this.    - The game can crash for a variety of reasons, although it is not near as bad as it used to be.. it is still a problem.    - PC Master race! I am a big hater for apple, however I can't run this on my linux machines - which is a major bummer.. Like, Through a windows wrapper you CAN, but it will be laggy.    - There are some botter problems, it is not often that you will run into one anymore.. but when you do it's annoying.     - Names. this game has been around for over a DECADE, there are A LOT of taken names.. But there is hope! this october (2015) they are releasing 15 MILLION names! That is a lot of new names to use! Be there to claim the good ones!!!    - Pretty big hog for resources if you have a dated computer.    - At this point I am struggling to come up with more cons, just download it.---------OLD REVIEW-------------I have played this game just short of ten years, I have never had a dull moment in it. When you're not off killing hords of unimaginable beasts, you're in town talking to friends from around the world. The game is brilliant, many people don't like the game due to the graphics, but it's the graphics that make the game. The story line is phenominal, in the Black Heaven update I cried - literally. It was a perfect addition to the story line. There are events on much of the time, so it's always tonnes of fun. This is not a pay to win game, I love it for that. I recommend you try this game fully before dismissing it :)

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 28, 2015
												I started playing Maplestory way back since Patch 1.83. Or 2007....The game has certainly changed much over the years...and will always keep changing, don't ever expect it to be the same for more than 3 months.  My main character has been level 200 for many years now and I have a 200 NPC In Kradia. So take my word for it, the game is now, just as playable as it ever was.  Many of the things we know and love are gone, like the challenges, or Temple of time being the most difficult location in the game (most players walk over pink bean now like he's a snail)..The direction of the game has changed, and is much more story driven now. Before you just made a character and made it your own story. But you can choose from several. AND I MEAN SEVERAL...different classes with a pre-determined story. And advance them to lv 250 (new level cap)  by grinding on monsters or doing party Quests.The game seems overwhelming at first, but once you get the world map down, you'll be navigating like a pro in no time. The 2D anime style chibi art makes the game much more social than any 3D MMO so feel free to take a break and grab a chair..(literally a chair) that you can buy or collect from events...and sit down and make some cyber friends! Or go gear up and be the God of Damage and solo every boss in the game and wow your friends. My major complaint about the game (and it's been this way forever) is that many ways to grow are all based on luck....nothing makes a person more angry than to spend Hard earned cash on a scroll, that ends up failing. It's always better to let other people do it....but on the other hand...you can sell sucessful gear at a higher price.This game used to be VERY ADDICTING...fortunately I was able to break off of it and do other things with my life after I hit 200, but the new update and all still hasn't pulled me back in. If you plan on getting into this game....you will certainly have a blast...all the confusion at the beginning is worth it and it has something for everyone!

A game like this cannot expect many adults to pay for, when there are some better alternatives out there. Kids would probably be more annoyed by the login procedures and would prefer something like Rift, Ragnarok or even Elsword.

content:
ber 2, 2015
												So I've played this game for a while now.  It says I have 0 hours logged because I've haven't been playing it on steam, but I've probably wasted well over a thousand hours on this thing.  There's this thing called the cash shop.  You can buy a crap ton of stuff from the cash shop, but there's a catch, it's all temporary.  You buy a thing and then it disappears after, say, 90 days.  I feel like this rips you off so damn much.  But if you play for long enough, you come by more than enough events,  So you don't have to spend any money.  But the thing is, if you actually want to get cool stuff like chairs and good looking clothes with amazing stats on them, you HAVE TO spend a crap ton of time in game grinding on mobs.  So if you want to get good at this game without spending any money on it, it's possible, but you have to have a ♥♥♥♥ ton of time on your hands on your hands.  Also, to be tolerant of this game, you have to be tolerant of anime.  If you want to be good at this game without spending money OR time, give up, it's impossible.  Unless you have someone else play for you... I guess...? But what's the point of that?  Overall I do recommend this game because of the nostalgia it causes to me and how fun and obsessing I first found it like 6 years ago.
