content:
7, 2016
												(Ignore the hours. The account attached to this was lost.)With how the game has been getting, I have to say there is more reason to give it a positive remark. I do have negative views about the company and how they've make it into a cash cow with their games, but I won't digress too much into this review about that and suggest reading my Mabinogi review about that.= - = - = - = - = Positives about the game = - = - = - = - =Balancing of Classes:For a long while, there were many classes that were just too overpowered and needed adjustments. Luckily, they fixed that in December of 2015 by giving necessary nerfs and buffs to classes. Many people would play a specific job (like Kaiser or Dual Blader), while neglecting other classes (like Evan or Aran) because they rather play overpowered over underpowered. I do see some jobs needing rework, but there is likely revamps going to happen.No Pay-2-Win Server (Reboot):This was necessary for the longest time because of how people can just drop $10 worth of Nexon Cash and end up with like 200+ million mesos for their character. It put a huge difference between the players who work for their money (by bossing or gathering) and people who can just drop money into the game.Easier for Beginners:I'm a veteran of this game for nearly 10 years and I remember the hardship of being sustained in the game, especially if you were a magician that relies heavily off of potions. Now, this game hands out money and potions like candy and I do support it, especially in the methods of how Nexon has done it.= - = - = - = - = Negatives about the game = - = - = - = - =Finding People to Work With:Unless you have friends that play this game personally and willing to keep you there, the game gets boring and some content does require you to be in parties. Even for me, I can't do some content without the help of a friend and I'm fortunate that I was employed at Maple-Radio for a point to obtain some active, nice friends during my tenure. The game in the previous years were quite easy to get into a guild and work together, but these days--it's harder to do so and can be a challenge. You may want to spend some time trying to get into some groups.The Company Itself:I can go from one end of the earth to the other about this, but they have milked this game (and others) dry with the Pay-2-Win complex. Alongside, there has been times the company would say one thing, but then take it back and proclaim they "never said that" or you're "twisting their words." If you have a negative view or complaint about the company, don't even dare try to say that on the Nexon Forums or you'll end up with the Hime fans pouncing all over you or potentially banned. (I've witnessed and was a victim of this myself.)Dead Servers:The higher you go up the server list chain (exception of Reboot), you'll notice that the game doesn't have a thriving community in some servers. If you want to stay in a small server, fine; however, you will pay the price of how expensive some things might be and how some content might be limited to you because of the population and economy.

content:
er 31, 2016
												Lore and StoryThis is something I found myself really getting into as I continued to play the game. The story has really taken off since Big Bang (a really controversial patch that was released in 2010). We actually started to get more information on who the Black Mage really was by this point, and beyond. We find out that he used to be a mage known as the "White Mage" as discussed in the Grand Athenaeum. He restlessly researched the light to see what was beyond it. He eventually realized that the "Ultimate light can only be found in the ultimate darkness."His research started to have more and more negative effects on the world, creating dark beings known as "Omens." Eventually he became corrupt by the power he obtained from the darkness. Not only was corrupted, but he allowed it to corrupt him. He eventually became what we know as the "Black Mage."These days, there are so many more lore quests to go through. Especially with Black Heaven out right now, it's gotten a whole lot darker, and a whole lot more interesting. I'd suggest checking these quests out if you plan on playing the game.Based on what I have experienced in the game's story: this is no mere "childish game." Unless you think characters dying on screen, and the occasional curse word (crap, damn, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, the words that would qualify a game for a Teen rating) are childish.Just to add a bit more, you actually grow attached to some of the characters. You gotta play to find out why. I can't explain it all.GameplayVery basic way of playing a PC game, and it fits this style. Abilities are able to be hot-keyed to YOUR liking ANYWHERE on the keyboard. Especially your basic functions such as jumping, walking, attacking, etc. You can customize your hot-keys to fit YOUR play-style (and yes I will continue to emphasize that). It's not hard to get the hang of this at all. Some classes do require you spam the attack button in order to refill specific substitutes for their MP bar. Examples are Demon Slayer with his Demon Force, Zero with his Time Force, and I think there maybe one more in there. Can't think of it right now.Grinding is something that you do when you're bored IMO. It gives you something to do, and if you want to gain some levels then yay! You want to level up! Though, grinding is the one glaring issue with this game. The only problem I have are the stupid and repetitive fetch quests. "Get me this from this monster" or "I need this many of this item from that monster." That is actually one of two complaints about this game, and I don't have any other issues with it other than the "Star Force" system. -_-"HOWEVER! The grinding in the game used to be fun to a degree. You would often find yourself partying with strangers or friends to go level up somewhere. While you did that, you would sit for a few moments to chat. Most of the time you would make a friend. Hell I got invited to several guilds up to 100+ people, and with 300+ member alliances. I think it's still fun if you know how to take a break for about an hour or two, or just stop all together because it will actually suck your life away. It's that addicting.

content:
r 31, 2014
												I've been playing Maplestory since I started Middle School (I'm a second year at High School) and I know that because I'm young I can make a few biases, but Maplestory is not a super, terrible, never-play game. It's a game that's only likeable to people who can make an honest judgement after putting a good few to several hours into the game and get to the in-game point and not just be an ignorant angry reviewer that makes a judgement after the tutorial (seriously, why do people do that xD).I will not lie, the game has it's pros and cons, some pros would be that the game is really fun to play with friends (especially for boss fights and Party Quests). There are a lot of unique quests, questlines (there is a difference xD), dungeons, and PQs (Party Quests) (These quests usually have stories that can be a little cliche, but, in my opinion, are still good). There is a vast amount of unique playable jobs (Somewhere around twenty to thirty). Each with a playstyle that fits almost any MMORPG player (I will admit, the jobs are really unbalanced but the game is 99% PvE so I tend to disregard that fact but it's out there)Some cons I will name are what take people away from the game (they're both good and bad reasons). One con that really takes people away is long-leveling (Really, let's be honest, can you name an MMORPG (that's pretty popular) that has a fast leveling system that doesn't get you to max level within 100hrs of gameplay?). Another bothersome (even for me) con is the amount of grinding (Ok haters, you got me there, grinding is a pain, but it's as well popular in a lot of MMORPGs). The worst con that people can't stand (for some reason) is the game is pay-to-win (from the reviews I've read) (That is ridiculous, I've seen the cash shop before and everything I saw was purely cosmetic or gave purchasable currency for events for cosmedic items).I know that this sounds pretty bias but a high majority of the things I've said are true, I've played the game for almost six years so I know what I'm talking about, I know this sounds a bit more like a rant but I'm just trying to convey the fact that this game is worth a try if it caught your interest, but I won't promise you'll like the game, but I'm sure it'll be worth the few to several hours you spend on the game. I hope you found my review/recommendation of Maplestory to be helpful or encouraging to you. I mean this game is free to play and you shouldn't spend real money on it if you're testing it's worth. Altogether I hope you enjoy your brief to everlasting Maplestory experience

ry 23
												DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME IF YOU DO NOT LIKE DOING REPTITIVE THINGS, LAG, UNSTABLE SERVERS, CRASHING OF THE GAME 30% OF THE TIME, MISJUDGEMENT OF GAME MASTERS.The reason I have only 0.1 hours is because I use the game launcher.The game has lost so much ever since I came back to it. I remember back in the days when party questing was live, I was always looking forward to party questing with other people but now they took the fun out of it. In party quest areas, you may find like 1 or 2 peeps, that is not enough to get you into one, and they may be 80% be afk They may try to attract you to the game by putting up events but it really is not worth it. Try another game. Plus Game Masters look investigater and suspend/ban legit players who report real hackers and let the hackers roam while they put the legit players on the ground for a month. It is just absurd, they are taking the very incentive that makes us report hackers, to get them banned. The community is pretty much dead as well. If you are looking to play, don't, you will just be wasting your time as have I.-I got banned for no reason. I was not using any illegal programs nor was I violating any policy. I have been playing all day and suiciding on purpose to not over level so I could play with someone while I look for some equipments. I am greatly disatisfied with this suspension as there are real hackers that I see on the server and I am always reporting them when I see them, but instead, I am the one that gets falsely accused by the program. This is unfair not just to me but the whole community as well. People who do not use illegal programs, such as myself, getting banned while the real ones stay botting or w.e., this is to be not treaded lightly.     Their customer service is not implemented well, when asked to provide information on why I was banned, all I got was "I understand that this is very upsetting, but any evidence obtained by Nexon is proprietary and we will not be able to release that information." and they would change the subject towards abiding the Terms of Services before playing the game. These gamemasters would keep saying that they had checked their evidence and would pass judgement on me by banning me but when they are asked to provide the evidence, they would avoid it (I believe they randomly ban people, that is why they do not hand out proof on why people get banned). Every response mentioned insisted that I should have read the Terms of Services and that I should commit to the agreement before I play. As to my knowledge, I have never broken any of those rules, I have gone through the list that they gave me multiple times and still unable to acknowledge the ban because I have never broke any of thoe terms and conducts they have provided. In addition, my time and effort put into leveling up my characters as fast as possible is labeled as leveling exploit (I was leveling so fast because I was strong and using the 1.5x/2x they gave us and the buffs that came with the event). I basically got banned for leveling up too fast, and when I tried to appeal, they ignored my requests and gave me no proof; I bet they did not want to admit that they banned the wrong person. In conclusion, I realized that they do not give a rat's ♥♥♥ about what we have to say. If these Gamemasters were judges, I am pretty sure they would pass the wrong judgements upon people such as letting the bad ones stay in society; meanwhile, caging the good ones in jail.If you are looking into this game, keep in mind that you have no voice in what-so-ever.

content:
ber 6, 2015
												First of all, many people who played in this game's early years are unhappy with the game because of the exp curve after the Big Bang patch. Nexon America made reaching the higher lvls a bit easier rather than grinding for weeks to only reach level 30 (Level cap is now 250.) As a person who played in the early years and currently, I honestly understand that they're upset about it, but those people need to get over it. They give the game negative reviews because they don't like change. With that being said, here is my review.A lot of reviews claim the game is Pay to win which is true to an extent however there only thing that makes the game Pay to Win is the cubing feature from the Cash Shop. For those who dont know what cubing is, it's a way to reset the stats on your equip's potential (Bonus stats) which cost 1.2k nx or $1.20 each for red cubes. However, There are cubes that don't cost any money, but drop from boss monsters or can even be crafted in game.Other people complain thats the game is pay to win because aesthetics (NX equip covers) have to be bought with real money. Most games sell aesthetics for real money (League of Legends Skins, H1Z1 clothes, CS:GO gun/knife skins) which people pay for so that isn't even an issue.While yes, Maplestory is a game that can be made easier for you by spending money, if you put in the time and effort to fund your character in game by bossing, farming, and utilizing the Free Market in game, you can easily enjoy the game without spending money. The only reason people complain is because they're impatient, and is that really the game's fault?With over 30 characters to try and many different bosses to fight, Maplestory is much more promising than these reviews lead you to believe. If you don't plan to spend a lot of money on the game to fund your character, I would suggest trying characters like Demon Avenger, Aran, or Zero (Must have a level 100 character to create, but worth it.) These classes have high base damage on skills and don't require nearly as much funding to do high damage on monsters/bosses compared to other classes. They're great for first starting out in the game! You could also play support classes like Kanna, (3rd job has a skill to increase spawn rate) Bishop, (3rd Job has +Exp Buff)  or Beast Tamer (Exp Buff in Cat Mode.) These classes are always wanted in training parties, especially high level training because of the support skills that they  provide. For help with training, bossing, or even game knowledge, make friends and join a guild! There are hundreds of guilds in each server, you just have to find the right one for you! Also check out the Maplestory reddit and Twitch.tv streams for even more help!

Play it if you want to test the waters, but unless you're the sort with a lot of disposable income, you will not enjoy this one bit.

content:
er 27, 2013
												I've been playing MapleStory since its initial release here in the US, and I sincerely wish that I could say great things about this game since I have so many fond memories of what this game was and the potential it had, but unfortunately I can't. This game has continued to warp itself into a twisted system for sometime now it's nearly impossible to really pinpoint when it happened. MapleStory focuses so much on just catering to the instant gratification aspect of human nature that they neglect to develop the team-play aspect of the game at all. It used to be, you needed a certain number of EACH job to get quests/bosses conquered but now you can either SOLO bosses and/or quests or just fill an expedition with all the same class and get the job done. The main reason for this is because MapleStory is so caught up with creating new classes that overpower its predecessors without focusing on gameplay aspect. Everyone wants to be the same class of character simply because it can beat out the rest with little to no effort and it is because of this that the economy in MapleStory fails as well. With so many websites to buy mesos and gear from, it's really hard to find anything affordable from other players at all. Everything about this game simply doesn't nurture any long term desire to stick with this game. There is no Team aspect like there once was, Market prices have escaped the realm of reason, and Nexon just keeps feeding this solo-play craze which simply defeats the purpose of an MMO all together. There is no sense of community here anymore, which really is a shame.

content:
y 20, 2014
												I remember back in the day when Maplestory only had four classes: the Magician,Warrior,Thief,and Archer. The game was very social and leveling was very hard. It was considered an achievement to reach your 3rd job. I kept playing until the Big Bang patch, which made leveling so much easier. Reaching the 3rd job and 4th job was easy and not an achievenent since everyone could do it. I kept playing after the Big Bang for maybe a month or two after i reached 4th job and quit.After returning to the game, it has lost it's social aspect and there are so many classes it gets confusing. There are jobs for your characters, crafting, and overall un-needed features that just confuse the player. These days, the game is just a grind and level game. Although the game before may also be considered a grind and level game there were social aspects that made the game actually fun to play. Not just playing to level and get better gear, but a game where you played to have fun with friends and leveling and gear was a bonus.IN THE END:  The game is just about grinding to level whereas before the game was played to have fun with friends and leveling and gear was a bonus.I really wish i could recommend this game, but the game is just not what it used to be.

												Now i'm gonna keep these real brief. If you are into cute graphics/sprites with feel attracted to this game. I know i was when i was like 11, still am though. Mainly because i like the "ANNNNNNNNNNNIME" feel that it's got going for it, and alright, cute looking things beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of other cute things, why not? Beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of things is really satisfing to me.I've grown up with beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of things. Final fight, Streets of rage, King of dragons, hell even Sonic blast man II. So yeah, i really enjoyed this game and was a "MIGHTY WARRIOR OF ANIME"I got around my 2nd job advancment and then, my eleven year old mind noticed something. "HOLY FRICK I SPENT TWO WEEKS TRYING TO GET THIS" and then i stopped playing for four years and got back into it with a new account because the eleven year old me was like "FRICKING LONG PASSWORDS MWHAHAHAHAHA"Anyway the now fifteen year old me blasted to level 45 in one day and he was like "Excuse me? b...but why? Last time i played this i CRIED BLOOD to get my 2nd job advancment. Now i can get to this high within one day? Jesus this game is so.....FUN" And then i lost about a months worth of my life playing nothing of maplestory and then mysterously quitting it again.now we come to the present. "WHOA, NEW MAPS?! NEW CLASSES?! EXLUSIVE SINGLE CLASSES?! WHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA?!"I mean no disrespect to the new classes at all, i was just tooken aback when i first saw them. It was like the eleven year old me just took control a flipped the hell out.Even though i keep coming back to this game....I....I can't recommend it to others, no matter how hard i try too. Yeah the games charming but beyond that the game is riddled with problems. Hackers, scammers, botters, Non-existent Gms, and hostile community.You'd best stay away unless you want to turn into a demon....And not spend MILLIONS OF HOURS ON THIS GRIND FEST OF A GOD DAMN GAME. SAVE YOURSELF!

content:
5, 2013
												This game has lost it's vibrance, quality, and community since its first revamp a couple of years ago.I can't say that the Big Bang update did the game any good. It made it more playable for the casual side of the gaming community, but for players like me, who enjoy the serious and competitive nature of games, has either become apathetic or not able to find motivation to play the game.To tell you how great the game was before any of this, because it was a really good one, whenever I watch a video that anyone has uploaded about the old versions of Maplestory I will start feeling noglastic. It's not like the more you see the more it reminds you of the good times, it hits me straight on. I remember how I first reach level 30, 70, and 120. I remember how I made friends with people who I am still in contact with today. I remember my first boss run or training party that I was in with a guild who was so kind and had a growing community. Those feelings were shot straight into my heart as soon as I watched a video that was posted by my guild.What Nexon got rid of that made many veteran and senior players quit or leave the game was it's challenges. The difficulity of leveling up brought many players together, forcing us to make party and guilds to better fare against the monsters that we faced. Making these connections with other players also allowed us to make friends, a bond that both players can feel even through distances. I know it sounds silly but that's one of the things MapleStory taught me, friendship.I won't say that MapleStory is bad game now, mostly because I still play it. People can still enjoy the game the way it is now. However, players who played the game for longer than a month before the Big Bang updates will understand me on this: MapleStory will never be able to give us that same exceptional feeling when playing. It's time has passed and so have most of us.Anyone interested in this game can very well try it. It has become more suitible for the casual audience now. I will warn you already that many of the game's feature will force you either to spend tons of time on it, or spend money to at least losen up that time. Yes, MapleStory is what people calls "Pay 2 Win." However it wasn't always like that, it use to be just for extra clothing. You didn't need anything to make you progress through the game with real money.tl;dr I recommend you to try it if you have never tried it before. If you don't like it then uninstall it. If you're a returning player then I'm warning you, everything is not the same anymore.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
13, 2015
												Maplestory is a 12 year old 2D MMORPG that holds a dear place in my heart. To put it in simple terms it plays like a platformer with all the classic RPG archetypes like Warrior, Priest and Rouge and some unique classes such as the melee Battle Mage and the spell-stealing Phantom.PROS------------ Tons of classes, plenty of variety- Never a shortage of quests and events- Still upated frequently after 12 years!- Unique artstyle and gameplay that no other game hasCONS------------ The Cash Shop. It's okay to offer cosmetics for a price but they also sell things that enhance your equipment that could only be bought with real money. As the late game becomes more about your gear, this presents problems. - Quests doesn't reward enough XP or gear compared to party quests and plain grinding. Leaves a lot of content untouched.- Some classes are rarely played (looking at you Jett and Marksman)All in all its a decent game that should be given a try. I played it with my friend for years and we keep coming back for some reason. Please send help.

I kept playing after the Big Bang for maybe a month or two after i reached 4th job and quit.After returning to the game, it has lost it's social aspect and there are so many classes it gets confusing. There are jobs for your characters, crafting, and overall un-needed features that just confuse the player. These days, the game is just a grind and level game. Although the game before may also be considered a grind and level game there were social aspects that made the game actually fun to play. Not just playing to level and get better gear, but a game where you played to have fun with friends and leveling and gear was a bonus.IN THE END:  The game is just about grinding to level whereas before the game was played to have fun with friends and leveling and gear was a bonus.I really wish i could recommend this game, but the game is just not what it used to be.

												Now i'm gonna keep these real brief. If you are into cute graphics/sprites with feel attracted to this game. I know i was when i was like 11, still am though. Mainly because i like the "ANNNNNNNNNNNIME" feel that it's got going for it, and alright, cute looking things beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of other cute things, why not? Beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of things is really satisfing to me.I've grown up with beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of things. Final fight, Streets of rage, King of dragons, hell even Sonic blast man II. So yeah, i really enjoyed this game and was a "MIGHTY WARRIOR OF ANIME"I got around my 2nd job advancment and then, my eleven year old mind noticed something. "HOLY FRICK I SPENT TWO WEEKS TRYING TO GET THIS" and then i stopped playing for four years and got back into it with a new account because the eleven year old me was like "FRICKING LONG PASSWORDS MWHAHAHAHAHA"Anyway the now fifteen year old me blasted to level 45 in one day and he was like "Excuse me? b...but why? Last time i played this i CRIED BLOOD to get my 2nd job advancment. Now i can get to this high within one day? Jesus this game is so.....FUN" And then i lost about a months worth of my life playing nothing of maplestory and then mysterously quitting it again.now we come to the present. "WHOA, NEW MAPS?! NEW CLASSES?! EXLUSIVE SINGLE CLASSES?! WHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA?!"I mean no disrespect to the new classes at all, i was just tooken aback when i first saw them. It was like the eleven year old me just took control a flipped the hell out.Even though i keep coming back to this game....I....I can't recommend it to others, no matter how hard i try too. Yeah the games charming but beyond that the game is riddled with problems. Hackers, scammers, botters, Non-existent Gms, and hostile community.You'd best stay away unless you want to turn into a demon....And not spend MILLIONS OF HOURS ON THIS GRIND FEST OF A GOD DAMN GAME. SAVE YOURSELF!

content:
, 2014
												MapleStory is a MMO RPG type game, where you play online with many others in different "worlds". The game is HUGE and has tons of stuff to do and things to purchase etc. The game is free to play, and you can fight monsters, join guilds, and train your character. Many customization options, updates are regular from the company, but the downside is the lagging and hackers in the game, and the "good" items cost real money, so I wouldn't recommend it anymore because of the massive lagging and hackers and they are always trying to get you to purchase virtual items!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
5, 2013
												This game has lost it's vibrance, quality, and community since its first revamp a couple of years ago.I can't say that the Big Bang update did the game any good. It made it more playable for the casual side of the gaming community, but for players like me, who enjoy the serious and competitive nature of games, has either become apathetic or not able to find motivation to play the game.To tell you how great the game was before any of this, because it was a really good one, whenever I watch a video that anyone has uploaded about the old versions of Maplestory I will start feeling noglastic. It's not like the more you see the more it reminds you of the good times, it hits me straight on. I remember how I first reach level 30, 70, and 120. I remember how I made friends with people who I am still in contact with today. I remember my first boss run or training party that I was in with a guild who was so kind and had a growing community. Those feelings were shot straight into my heart as soon as I watched a video that was posted by my guild.What Nexon got rid of that made many veteran and senior players quit or leave the game was it's challenges. The difficulity of leveling up brought many players together, forcing us to make party and guilds to better fare against the monsters that we faced. Making these connections with other players also allowed us to make friends, a bond that both players can feel even through distances. I know it sounds silly but that's one of the things MapleStory taught me, friendship.I won't say that MapleStory is bad game now, mostly because I still play it. People can still enjoy the game the way it is now. However, players who played the game for longer than a month before the Big Bang updates will understand me on this: MapleStory will never be able to give us that same exceptional feeling when playing. It's time has passed and so have most of us.Anyone interested in this game can very well try it. It has become more suitible for the casual audience now. I will warn you already that many of the game's feature will force you either to spend tons of time on it, or spend money to at least losen up that time. Yes, MapleStory is what people calls "Pay 2 Win." However it wasn't always like that, it use to be just for extra clothing. You didn't need anything to make you progress through the game with real money.tl;dr I recommend you to try it if you have never tried it before. If you don't like it then uninstall it. If you're a returning player then I'm warning you, everything is not the same anymore.

												I played this game when it first came out and have seen it go downhill. The more this game gets updated the worse it gets. Many of the highest ranked players have hacked or are continously hacking to reach the top leaderboards. To be able to fight the powerful bosses to get the best items you must pay REAL MONEY and spend it on cubes that give a small percent chance to change your crappy item into something amazing... something like .01%. This game is PAY FOR FUN when you reach higher levels. You will end up paying real money on 3'rd party websites where an employee or owner will log in and give you the ingame money that they have hacked for. Reaching high levels and getting decent items for bossing will require a MASSIVE amount of time, or a MASSIVE amount of real life money, or you just pay a 3'rd party website that hacks for the items to come into the game and give you what you paid for. This game is going downhill each year and loses players each year. The few that are left are die hard fans who spend thousands of dollars weekly to legitametly get good items. Overall this game is a 2/10 since at higher levels you are almost forced to use 3'rd party illegal websites. As they end up being cheaper than spending your real life money in the actual game!!!

content:
er 25, 2016
												Ive been playing this game since the first two years it came out. It has improved by leaps and bounds since then, and I kepe coming back after brief hiatuses. Without a doubt, if you're into Asian RPGs, this game can be a powerful addiction for you...Pros:-Visually appealing for an Asian RPG-Decent community, and sizable population even after years of existing-F2PCons:-Very grindy. Lots of farming, though its amount is constantly being lowered.-can be very much P2W in the endgameEven though I have a hate/love relationship with this game, I would still recommend it in the end. At the very least, try it out and play through the base content, without commiting yourself to all the sidequests, endgames, etc. just to feel out the overall game.Speaking from a perspective that has been here for more about a decade (at the time of writing this, starting from 2006 until today Nov 25 2016), this game never ceases to surprise me with all the improvements it gives the players... although I say that because MapleStory had needed many changes to get where it is today.

content:
25, 2015
												All the negative reviews are truthful, all the positive reviews are sarcastic negative reviews (no, really, go read them for yourself) with witty humor thrown in from time to time.This game sucks. It's cute, charming to a degree, and was once a great way to meet great people, many many years ago. But it's a shell of what it once was, a  "pay 2 win" title of the worst kind. When you aren't in game, throwing away hundreds of dollars on NX cash so as to remain somewhat viable, you're wrestling with the game's frequent crashes and server downtime. In addition to that, hackers have been a looming problem in this game for as long as its been available, and they tend to not only disrupt the game's already struggling economy, but put you at risk for loss of valuable goods. It had gotten so bad at one point that players were pointing fingers at each other, essentially saying "You should know what you can and cannot buy!" and "Even if you got it legit, you shouldn't complain, its for the good of the server, it has to be done!".Flawed. Broken. Buggy. Filled full of unfriendly people, and is a shell of its former self. This game is a has-been.Its terrible. Avoid at all costs. It's sad to watch your childhood wither away like this, but unfortunately, it needs to die. They've ruined it.

												Why you should play maplestory:-If you play MMOs for the story, maplestory has several storylines you can follow, all of which are kinda alright (Like that anime which you kinda wanna watch cus it looks cool but it still looks bad but you do it anyway and its as expected but was a good time.)-Maplestory 2 is coming. Maplestory 2 is technically a prequeal but do you really want to come back to play this game afterwards? Get the old one out of the way.-It was kind of a revolutionary step in time. Being one of the first platforming MMOs it deffinatly has a decent ammount of appeal.-Killing things is some how satisfying despite the combat system.-The minigames are a ton of fun and if you can make friends in game or get your friends to play then its even better.-It defined a point in history that encouraged internet safety as many angsty kids stole from their parents to buy ingame items. THIS IS NOT NEXONS FAULT!!! The parents should have kept a better eye on their cards, the kids shouldnt have stollen, and to be fair they could have used it on anything else online.Why you shouldn't play maplestory:-The community does kinda suck.-Its hard to train on anything but bosses unless you are in a party.-The combat leaves something to be desired.-The cash shop will burn a whole in your wallet. (If you use it.)-Its kinda a waste of time-Good luck getting your friends to play it.Personally I'm just here to get ready for maplestory 2

												MapleStory has always been a fun social game, with the added bonus that it was incredibly fun to grind on.I originally stopped playing due to the rampant botting, hacking, and pay-to-win allowed by Nexon.I recently began to play again because Nexon launched a new server, Reboot. Here, there is no pay-to-win but there's still many botters. The botters never bothered me since I always did my own thing -- that's the point of Reboot, you do you.I recommend anybody to play, even if just a bit.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
y 6, 2016
												This review is based on the Reboot server.Maplestory is a fun 2D MMORPG to burn time. The game is very easy to get into for new players. There is ingame guide and given starting meso bags. Despite its grindy nature, MS does have a wide variety of classes to choose from and each class is unique. If farming monsters bore you, there are always party quests. For the returning old school MS players. Reboot is not the good old MS. Reboot resembles the version near the time shortly after the Big Bang update. The Cash shop is mostly cosmetic in the Reboot server. It's still good to jump in and play for a few hours to satisfy that nostalgia of good old Maplestory.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2015
												Maplestory, a game that in it's early days promoted hard earned levels, items, and achievements. This premise of challenging gameplay where you had to grind away many days to earn the most simple goals is what originally attracted me to the game. The feeling of being able to achieve what most wouldn't dare to do, kept me coming back for more. I literally feel like I could write a book on my many years of experience in this game. So I want to keep this review short, and write that book later. From playing beta to now (2015)This game is always changing, and no matter how much hard effort you put into it, a year or so later it will be irrelevant.If you do decide to play this game, please do not spend so much on NX. It's a very hard temptation to ignore, but you will be less depressed in the end. I have spent way more in this game over the years, I literally could have bought a second vehicle, brand new. Not only just in money, but time. So my advice, play this with some friends, have a good time, and don't worry about having the most 'elite' items, because that only makes you fall into a money trap that you will regret in life later.

Items that were worth something are now worth nothing for the most part. I feel like the community has gotten harsher as time passed but there are still friendly players around. The game is always changing and adding the most random ♥♥♥♥ possible so it is hard to keep up. The total players are split among different servers so some are completely dead even after server merges. Last time I played this game, the game was so bloated and not optimized that well but I am not sure if thats still the case. I just back from time to time and return to a dead guild and dead friends list, so if you make good friends make sure to stay in touch or you will lose them possibly forever. I wouldn't recommend this game to most people due to the fact that if you don't spend money on the game you will probably never be as good as someone who does. People drop mad money in this game to make their characters look pretty and others drop mad money to reach the highest dps obtainable. They will talk ♥♥♥♥ and look down on you if you even drop by their group of friends and say hi. It's like high-school with the cliques. You have the athletes who train non stop and you have the cool crowd.It can be a fun game, though but it gets tempting to drop $5 from time to time

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
er 19, 2016
												NOTE: This is a very big "IF" recommendation.This game is made by a greedy company that only cares about getting money. Wether the developpers of the game care or not, they are probably forced into decisions that realllly encourage paying.That is, if you actually plan on playing the game efficiently.This game is simple, unless you're going into high level end game raids with people, that is the only time I can think where this game gets complexe and requires actual planning.Until then, most of the game is litteraly just pressing a single OP power button and watching a screen full of enemies dying with massive numbers showing up on screen?So WHY would I recommend this game?Because somehow, MapleStory makes that sensless room clearing one shotting grinding for days entertaining to watch.Its not complex, its not complicated, pick the weapon with the highest stats, apply all your buff/debuffs, then just spam away with that one attack that fills the whole screen with pretty explosions and lights and make you feel somehow like you're REALLY powerful, way over the top, and just sit back and enjoy the fireworks.That's really all you do, and when you reach the job advancements, you suddenly get even cooler looking and prettier powers to enjoy.And now they have a 5th job advancements with even BIGGER and PRETTIER attacks to use.Their are so many choices, all the classes, all the different job advancements, just choose what looks the coolest to you, find the nearest NPC that tells you where to go to kill 100 enemies or collect 100 items of one type, go there, and just watch and have fun seeing massive numbers pop up.But if none of that sounds fun, if you're looking for a well polished, super complex RPG, you wont like this game for the first 100 levels or more.I've heard that the end game raids can be tough and require a planned out raid party, no idea if its true, I never got that far. But the time it takes to reach that level isn't as bad as it looks since this game loves its level up events where you get like 3 levels per level up, slicing the time it takes to 1/3 of the ammount. Either way, it still takes a bit though.And in the end, the game still isn't as complex as some other MMORPG, I'm not an expert but I've heard better from other MMORPG games, so look elsewhere for super in depth and interesting MMORPG games. But if you're looking for some time to kill, to just sit back and watch things die as you watch some stream or youtube video or you're just waiting for something to be done, this game does a surprisingly good job, for free. All the in game purchases are usually for people who want to level faster or who want to get end game stuff quicker or reaaaallly max out their characters but, if you're just trying to kill time, this game does an amazing job at entertaining you for a few hours before you move on with your life.I'll never take this game seriously, but if I'm ever bored and got nothing to do, this game is always one of my go to picks for killing time and simply having a casual fun time with the game.Once again, no idea exactly how complex this game gets at the higher levels, I'm sure it does get "better" later on as any hardcore maplestory player might say. But until you get to that point, it all depends on how much you enjoy watching hundred of enemies fall to that massive screen filling energy blast you just used.

												Where do I start here.. Man, this game is pretty.. lame honestly. The game itself is fine, but how it runs is atrocious. It has issues with certain headsets, keyboards, etc. Still hasn't been fixed.. and I've seen stuff about it since 2010.Overall, the game just would freeze every 4-5 seconds for about half a second for me, even without the set headset plugged in, and I couldn't figure out why. I've tried playing without any usb's plugged in, still nothing. I've tried messing with about everything on the game and still freezes every 5-ish seconds. For whatever reason the devs still have not fixed the issues with the game when you use those headsets/keyboards/mice after several years so I cannot suggest this game. Like, 6 years and you still don't solve an issue like that? lmao... My issue with the game doesn't seem to be with the headsets/etc. It just freezes constantly, and honestly its stupid. Well, if I want to play a game I guess I can go to every other game and it would work perfectly fine however this one doesn't. I can't recommend this when there are better 2d/fighter/brawler games out there. Especially when this one has had issues for 6 years not being resolved, then it just not working for me. For whatever reason anyway.

												This game, Maple Story, is truely a magnificent diamond. I first played Maple Story when the era "Big Bang" was on, at the time the game was at it's prime state. I don't know how long ago that was, maybe 6+ years ago.The game is not as good as it was before. I'm not going to butter this, the game right now is really terrible compared to what it was before. I detest it, and so do most other players that also played during "Big Bang." Nevertheless, I and many other people play the game because of nostalgia and big digits. I remember I met my first love and lost my virginity in Maple Story, which is why I love the game.  If I had the option to go back in time and tell my past self something related to Maple Story, it would be "Kid, this game is going to destroy your life, but you will also reach enlightment and become happy." Overall, I still crawl back to play this horrible game, reminds me of the good days. I personally enjoy it.

y 21
												I've played a little over 15 hours of the game. It's a great game under two circumstances: 1) You have a friend/friends to play with. 2) You actually understand how to play the game. Without these two things it gets really boring very fast, too much repetitive grinding for quests with drop rates being odd and sometimes making things last far longer than they should. It's a great game and I'm sure it was lots of fun when the community was bigger but there are just too few people online now and there just isn't enough information told in game. I hardly understood anything about what I was doing even while I was reading guides for it. After 15 hours I got to level 53 out of a max of 250, and the game just isn't entertaining enough for me to get those other 197 levels.

												This game has a long history. For many it was their first MMO ever played. While this game is still somewhat fun it has become considerably a pay-to-win game. With the introduction of item stat %'s Nexon introduced a Cash Shop item you can purchase with real money called a Miracle Cube. Cubes allow for the reset of item potentials and to even raise the potential to a much higher percentage at a random chance. If you want to deal a massive amount of damage and be an unstoppable boss slaying machine. Chances are you'll have to buy mesos, the in-game currency, or cubes to boost your weapons and armor.

It's a bad game, a cluster♥♥♥♥ of story and characterization that isn't very well done by any aspect, but which attempts to compensate for its weaknesses by adding in excessive NX ♥♥♥♥♥♥ry and ERP. The normal anon can see this as the ♥♥♥♥ it is, and may enjoy it, hate it or be indifferent to it, but all the while recognizing that the game itself, regardless of their opinion, is plain bad.However, these very aspects that try to smear over the ♥♥♥♥ of its core make it a breeding ground for aspie, unsociable underageb& ♥♥♥♥♥♥s who engage in every kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ry both online and in the real world. The crossdressing pale white nerds all trying their hardest to look cute, the deeps, peculiar, colorful clothes, the whole night lord ♥♥♥♥♥♥ry and everything about the Maple world fuels their escapist fantasies, while the pity-party character backgrounds, emphasis on revenge, and overall preachiness of the series make it fit just right with the mary-sueish drives of your average preteen and his sense of unwarranted self-importance towards the world. Exactly the kind of ♥♥♥♥ that makes little kiddies and underageb& ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ eat this ♥♥♥♥ right the ♥♥♥♥ up.

content:
er 14, 2013
												I have been playing this game for over six years on and off, way before it was on Steam. I have really seen the game grown over the years, for better and for worse however it seems it has been for the worse. As Nexon releases updates, they have added many new classes that outclass and overpower the originals. These new classes are usually much more flashier and stronger than the orignals, making them more popular. The new classes can often solo bosses, something that use to be impossible and defeating the purpose of teamwork.Through several updates, the game has also become much too easy to level up, unlike how it use to be. Also, Nexon has made the game very pay-to-win like. Often people who have the money to spend on NX have the better equipment in game from the equipment enhancment system. As the game advanced, Nexon has made many changes which altered the game drastically. One of these changes made in game world feel much more smaller than it use to be. Many and almost all of the maps have been compressed into compact versions, making traveling very different than it use to be. The game world use to be much larger and you could get lost in it and still have fun.Finally, Maplestory has been a host to many bugs/hacks/down time. The game has been hacked many times, often causing damage to the econonmy and forcing server rollbacks. Hackers seem to also be quite common, seeing as a hacker(s) posted the login ID's of over 50 thousand players, including myself. The also game has more than a few bugs that can affect gameplay or quests, forcing unexpected maintenances.

												When I first made this review, I put no, because I thought the game had no purpose, but now i realise that a game doesnt need a purpose to be fun.Many people know maplestory as that game that was popular a long time ago but then Nexon bought it out and made the game totally pay to winWell that people, is wrong.Maplestory is no longer a pay to win game, I would say it is pay to progress, or pay to get higher level faster. Once you farm yourself to a higher level it gets easy to from millions, as there have been many features added to the game making it easier to get high tier items.Some Examples -- Daily boss runs can net you good experience and you can sell the potions you get which stack up in money over a while.-Commerci runs - if you farm this enough you can end up with items like sweetwater glasses and tattoos, which sell for over 200 mil each.- Easy gollux - this is harder to do, as there are a bunch of annoying prequests, but you can use the coins you get from farming gollux to get pretty good gear that you can sell.-Elite Boss Farmiing- This is something all levels can do but its totally based off luck if you get anything good, if you want to know what this is go check out a guide as it is pretty lengthy to explain.- Taking advantage of events going on - there are always events that are going on that can rack in some major dough, and can boost your damage pretty significantly.Some reasons I personally play maplestory are -- I enjoy the grindiness of the game, Its something I do when I am bored of the other games I am playing and if i play a bit every day it can add up in the long run.- Using twitch.tv, you can find a multitude of streamers to play with which add a totally different aspect of the game. These streamers are very generous with their items and will do a lot of give aways!- I like the look of the game and I love the classes that are available for creation, my personal favorite is night lord!These are just some of the reasons I play the game, and there are lots of people who agree with me. I know there will always be people who disagree but I am okay with that and I dont expect them to play it with me.

Solo can get you far, but the hardest bosses like Lotus and Damien... those you won't beat in a VERY long time (even with a VERY strong team unless everyone hit cap damage of 50mill)

												For the sake of this almost being a successful game for 9 years, I better say something.Looking back then, I saw interest in an 2D MMO that was popular and successful? (Seriously, How is that even possible?)Anywho, Heres what you wanted to know.Pros: Very Fun, Different kind of feel for an MMO, a wide variety of classes, plenty of people in the community to play with, lots of quests/dungeons/ and areas to explore.Cons: The "wide variety of classes" may be overwhelming (Nexon is dumping out as many as they can), Grinding can be a pain in the ♥♥♥, Inventory can fill up quickly, Your character might not look so "Exciting" if you don't purchase a thing or two from the Cash Shop, Most Cash Shop items are only temporarily  **WHY :(**In a nutshell: I always find myself coming back to this game to see whats new. Gives you a great new feel since its a 2D MMO, and if you plan to play then bring a friend!

content:
1, 2016
												As a person who played Maplestory back in...man, back when Ragnarök Online was still alive and kicking, I can say that Maplestory's early levels consists of agonizing grind...at least it used to. Now leveling to 70 is easy; however, anything beyond level 70 is a massive and agonizing grindfest consisting of burning so much money on XP boosting scrolls you'll find that at least 300 USD is needed to actually reach 120+, effort not included. To truly hit endgame requires level 210, and basically everyone at that level has so many cash shop items it's not funny; this is the norm for Maplestory. If you want to consider yourself as 'hitting the cap' in Maplestory, you'll have to spend over 500 USD, probably. Thankfully they got rid of that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t Jump Quest for whatshisface, the angry golem ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that spaminates your screen with more energy beams than a US player in C&C Generals. Don't even get me started on HP Washing and other cashshop item related tactics to forcibly boost your stats to absurd levels. It's that kind of game.-Update-With the levelbuying option and significant exp gain increases, reaching 120 is pretty much a cakewalk. This is extremely depressing for me, because I had to spend the better part of 2 months to get 3 or so chars to 120, with EXP boosts included. For those of you who did not have to go through this grind, I hate your guts because you all get to take the easy path now. Seriously, bugger off.

content:
y 16
												Been playing this game for 7-8 years; started in 2009.Can say with experience that this game has truly grown and that it has had its fair share of ups and downs, but does not fail to exceed the limitations of any avid RPG lover, whether they are casual or competitive, new or veteran.Community, while beginning to lack as it ages, is very cooperative and expansive (if you go on channel 1 that is lol), but also requires some form of teamwork and strategy, a fun aspect.Gameplay, controls, menus, gui are really weird now since I haven't played for a while but is still user friendly nonetheless, and makes it easy to learn if you're new.Classes are unique, have great storylines and mechanics.Only negative things I would say about this game is that levelling up has gotten a bit too easy now due to all the events and x2 things but, honestly, that's how the game always has been with rewards, but it's a bit more HAM now.Overall, probably one of the best, groundbreaking games that I've played in ages, and I think that it will be for you too.

2, 2016
												If you do get this game, be prepared for: an elitist and toxic community who won't help players, use gazillions of dollars to buy cubes (items that change your equipment potential to great stats) to be actually noticed by someone, to farm the same spot over and over again in gaps of levels and to read megaphones with stupid people showing off their stuff bought out from their parents money.Don't get me wrong. the game itself its great and it has great potential, I had a blast playing it years ago and coming back from time to time but its players who are looking down on everyone just because they got lucky with a cube, because they're on a certain guild, or because they're friends with someone who is "famous" really bothers the hell out of you.The thing I like the most about this game are bosses, but they are ruined because you can either solo them if you're overpowered, or not do them at all because no one will like to carry/help you.This is a game for fun. Not a game to get serious.Unless you do have gazillions of dollars and want to throw them all away at buying cubes or selling in-game currency to buy overpowered weapons.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
												This game is great for passing time. If you enjoy playing MMORPG's but dislike playing with people, this is the game for you. The levling system is very grindy. Unless you have a friend giving you an exp boost or increasing the mob spawn in the map, most of your time playing this game will be spent leveling alone. They have a 'Reboot' world that doesn't allow trading or purchasing item upgrades with real money, which I actually enjoy because it get's rid of Pay-to-Win players. All of you equipment actually must be earned on the character you are playing on. You can share the in-game currency, mesos, between your characters and a few usable items, but no equipment and such. They still have the other worlds where you can trade and spend hundreds of real dollars trying to upgrade a single piece of equipment, but I definitely recommend the Reboot world.

11, 2014
												Only have about 20 mins of gameplay.I don't hate this game as I did not spend much time with it but..If you want instant action don't expect it from this game.First you need to make a seperate account from steam, then make a character and there are so many names already taken that it will take you a very long time to get a name.Also there are several restrictions to name making, you can't have too many of the same letters, lots of words are blocked that are not even inappropriate.Skipping the tutorial, then getting put into what feels like a tutorial with characters chatting non stop teaching you things that you expected to skip, feels like you never get to experience the game.It just takes way too long to get to the action so I had to click uninstall. The videos make it look like it's fun and all but, I can not stand having to go through a rediculous amount of game setup andlearning tutorials.So, If you are like me and like to get right into the action and start having fun, don't expect to have that fun for what feels like an hour.I would much rather recommend a game like Terraria instead of this game as it's newer but it's not quite mmorpg.If you have the patience to go through all the steps and enjoy reading lot's of pop ups, then go for it. As I said before, I can't say it's a bad game. It's something you will have to just try for yourself.Also, at the time of this post, expect a update/patch of 500+ MB after downloading the game.Anyways, Hope you enjoy it more than myself if you do choose to try this game.

content:
6, 2015
												This game... I swear. It has so many problems. Crashes and irresponsiveness are common, and everything is hard to find or confusing. Default controls are unfriendly, and remapping them are even more so. Character creation is the worst. The classes seem to have little difference, and often your character will disappear from the selection screen for no reason. Furthermore, names of characters that have disappeared will claim to be taken, as if name creation isn't difficult enough. The passcode required to create, play, and delete characters is very time-consuming, as the keys are randomized, as if the username and password aren't enough.With all these problems combined, I couldn't even get past the tutorial to see the actual game. Do not let its pretty graphics fool you. My rating is 2/10.

												This game is a big number generator. This game is good from levels 1-130 afterwards any improvement to your character is based off rng cubes and equipments that drop from bosses that are too hard to kill and equips that have an extremely low drop rate.  The only server worth playing is reboot but progress is slow and grinding takes forever to increase power levels. The community for this game is useless as anything important can be soloed and nothing requires a party as soloing gives much more exp than any quest or party quest. The 5th job is just a glorified hyper skill system that requires hours of grinding to collect arcade nodes and symbols. This game is not worth playing as it is basically legalized gambling to kids and should be illegal as the gambling practices are addicting and subliminal.

content:
6, 2015
												It's not worth it! It's most likely the most pay-to-win game you will ever play, and it has even degenerated into a hack-to-win game instead of less because of the decreasing value of even the most essential drops despite of their increasing rarity. Even in-game upgrade items not coming from anything related to its cash shop aren't worth it anymore.Back then, we didn't have a gambling-based upgrade feature called the "Potential system" plus it has always taken nothing but your own patience and a single pay-to-win item called the "Regular Shop Permit" in which you only had to spend $2 and it's always been taking you far. First of all, the value of most items has deflated whilst the hardest-to-obtain items were not only expensive but also obtainable only from the hardest boss battles (something that only people who spend thousands of dollars in this game will likely not going to achieve). Second of all, the values of most drops were slowly decreasing even further along with an increasing amount of funded players obtaining drops from the hardest bosses, making the $2 Shop Permit even less powerful. Now valuable drops are either rare in-game, or only obtainable from the Cash Shop.Not only the game itself has degenerated into pay-to-win/hack-to-win, but also the vibrant community itself has turned into a more hostile environment where it's no longer an athletic competition, but instead more a mix of a bodybuilding and weightlifting competition with a twist of gambling as its performance-enhancing element. In other words, skill doesn't matter as much as I usually found this game before. Also, even though the game's features were being adjusted to favor the more matured demographic, even 22-year-olds don't act like their age and are harassing in their most serious ways possible, such as starting drama and reporting each other. It's a complete nightmare come home!Also, it is important to note the game's also imbalanced in the aspect where ever since an update called "Unleashed", you cannot hit anywhere near maximum damage even if you spend $2500 in this game, and this is more pronounced if you opt for high hits-per-second classes such as Kaiser and Dawn Warrior, or you cannot solo the hardest bosses despite you've spent that much for it. It does do a disservice to even a funded player, unless once in a blue moon you win a jackpot on a casino or something. Just to know how imbalanced the classes are, I spend $700 to fund a Hero (which is a warrior) whilst I could get about the same results by spending nothing on MS but the $2 Permit with less endgame gears or potentials. To make things even worse, they promised fifth job once and they said they'll not going to open fifth job any time soon, and they never did.Now, the only two things that are saving MapleStory are its original 2D gameplay that not even Elsword or WonderKing Online can compete with the original thing, in addition to Nexon's over-the-top events and MapleStory's vibrant community that they always have had. I wonder if this is any longer going to be the case, because I doubt so. I doubt it even more because of the nerfs that happened during the updates named "Unleashed" and "Shining Star" which made it even harder to gather up merchandise for your Shop Permit without relying on random reward features such as "Gachapon Tickets", "Marvel Machine", or "Premium Surprise Style Boxes", because of the amount of nerfs and HP increases pertaining to Party Quests, training, and boss runs. If they continue to nerf the game even further, you can kiss goodbye to this pastime you've loved too much.As far as I know, this is about one of the few games I ever know where the community is as bad the the game itself. I'm not sure if this is even worth playing anymore. I've played several MMOs and I found even Mabinogi is in a better state. I'm so disappointed with MS that I'm even going to give it a a 1-star rating.

The GoodNice Art StyleNice music, very fittingLots of content. (35 classes, lots of PQ's and bosses)Game gets updated often. High level cap (250 level cap)The BadThe Community. There is a PQ that gives insane EXP and everyone just does that and nothing else.Game seems poorly optimized often freezing when a lot of players are on screen or you open the map or quest logQuests are what you'd expect. Kill X, Collect Y, bring back to Z.  Nothing new here.Combat can feel very grindy.A bit pay to win. (Although Nexon has been rectifying that lately).Recommend?You'd really have to try it out for yourself and see if you'd like it because it's not a game that everyone likes. I personally have been playing for years and love it.

While at a first glance, the community is bad, If you try to find actual friends it can be lots of fun. Easily a 9/10 in my book.

The game has gotten a lot easier, however, so if you're looking for a challenge, look elsewhere. If you are looking for a nice addicting time killer, you've come to the right game. While at a first glance, the community is bad, If you try to find actual friends it can be lots of fun. Easily a 9/10 in my book.

r 1, 2014
												I started playing Maplestory years ago, and my god.. this is a fun game. When I first start playing I pick the old Dawn Warrior as my starter class and I ended up loving it. I put alot of work and money just to make it to 120 and.. I never did. Back then leveling up was much more challenging and I'd say it's alot of fun. Now after I recently played again and create a new Hero class called "Shade"level up from 10 to 120, I said to myself"What the heck happen to the game?" I thought I was a pro, but it turned out the game was now just too easy. I even got bored of training and nowadays, trainings is just a labor you want to do.Bosses are now too easy most only required 1 player doing a solo run,not even breaking a sweat.Now it's the amount of money i don't always likes, the poor amount of money after a lv.10 mob dropped is ranged from 8-20 mesos(in-game currency) while a piece of equipment lv.10 cost 1k and you might think thats easy but a lv.50 cost about 55k+.Still,it's not the money I'm complaining, it's the fun I had thats gone.I could have recommended this game but those days are over,the gameplay feels so hollow now.If you play this game anyway, you'll regret it.P.S I know it said I play zero hours,but trust me I play it on the official website.

												Maplestory is a pretty fun game to play if you have friends to play with you. I have mixed feelings about post Big Bang Maplestory. While it made the game much easier and a bit of a grind fest, lots of content had been added that makes the grinding feel fun at times. Since I lasted played I've heard they added some features to encourage group play which is also good. Many people say Maplestory is pay to win and it certainly does help; however, you can still get just as far for free. Overall, I'd say Maplestory is a good game to play if you have friends and some spare time. TL;DR: Play with friends 7.5~8/10, Play without friends 6~6.5/10

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
y 31, 2015
												Some long term players seem to object that this game is good; however, this game is good. I say this with an unbiased view simply because I don't have long term experience affecting what it is now and thus I'm not making that biased comparison. This means I'm giving this review based on the NOW -- reduces review bias/corrupting a review from a nonbiased standpoint.Now that I've said this lets get it started.I started as a Xenon and dove right into the Resistance in which the class begins to take on the persona of it's intended story line. After a few hours of play there seems to be a bigger change that kept making me quit the game in the past. This is the grind is much easier. Now I'm not sure if it's because of the current model or because the Xenon class is quite powerful for an all around class, but it is definitely much more easier to level in the game.If you like Anime and the storyline within Anime then you will quite possibly enjoy the game simply because it has some of that similar style within its dialog -- specifically the Episodes which is a short version of titles like Attack on Titan or Sword Art Online.The only down fall I'd say the game actually has is the navigation system. Now by this I do not mean movement of the character but instead the finding of NPCs for quests that need to be completed is quite hard sometimes. I had to do some google searching to find out where the NPCs for a quest is at so I can complete/begin them. In the end, if you can overlook the fact you level quicker in the game than years ago, and are able to tolerate the fact you may need to do some google searching on where the turn-in NPC is for a quest. Then you're going to enjoy the game so as long you don't dislike sidescroller games, and Anime. If you do dislike, then this game is probably not for you.The graphics are the same as they always were though so no real graphical improvements unless you want to talk effects... Anyways, try the game. If you wonder whether or not the cash shop is expensive or not then I'd like to say it isn't because your money does go pretty far if you spend it wisely. Now, if you don't do cash shop then that is fine because your not really missing anything other than maybe an auto-loot pet and the chance to win some in-game money to give you a good start at earlier levels.

content:
y 11, 2014
												ive played this game off and on for about 9 years and id have to say i keep comming back, here are some quick pros and cons pros-can be fast paced combat endlessly-really cool/flashy spells and abilitys (mostly later on at higher lvls)-interesting classes and they all feel a little different despite having so many different paths/classes to choose-i find the world to be a good size, not to big not to small-allways alot of people around if you like to be social-ive noticed over time they make some really great improvements to the game so updates dont feel useless usualycons-can be extremely repetetive-there isnt really much insentive to get to max level like other mmos where you can do raids or somthing like that, basically not much changes at max level-can be hard to get good weapons and armor from the free market due to insane pricesover all that would be the things i notice the most, i like the game and enjoy it once in a while but it was never one that i could stick to and get addicted to, maybe thats not a bad thing but there was never much there to keep my apeal to last for a long period , unless you had friends who played but mine all quit about 5 years ago so it gets pretty boring pretty fast for me.if you want a game to log into and just kill monsters all day in a fast paced side scroller with wicked abilitys and classes then i would highly recommend this game, somtimes i just want to kill endless monsters all day and feel awesome while doing it and this is the game i log into to do it.

												Keep in mind this is my opinion.  I understand that maplestory is a very different game, and A LOT of people do not enjoy it. I have been playing maplestory for years, I believe it is a very good game.I joined around the release of the pirate, the fifth job/class to the hero Maplestory is a different type of MMO, you don't really do quest all that much in this game, it's always been more of a grind.This can be good, and bad.Early game is encredibly easy in every way, monsters killable, leveling stable/quick, and money isn't a problem.Later on in the game it can be a giant pain, you need funds to buy potions, you need to have "godlike eqps" each bought for tons of IN GAME money.You can play this game without spending a dime, personally I have spent a good bit of money on this game, but I do not regret it.~Pro/ConsPros: cuteeasytime wastercons:end game leveling is roughyou may not like the style of gameplay (grinding)people can be elitest if you don't have specific gear.

content:
er 7, 2016
												I played this again out of nostalgia and was curious to see what changed. While the additions were interesting, it didn't take me too long to remember why I stopped playing this in the first place. The gameplay gets stale really quickly since all you're ever doing is hunting down monsters and collecting items. There's really not that much variety to the quests handed to you since it's always one of three things--kill a certain amount of monsters or collect a certain amount of items said monsters have dropped. This is probably why I stopped playing MMOs in general, but there were some that brought a little variety into things. It was a nice trip down memory lane, but I'm not surprised I lost my interest so quickly this time around.

content:
4
												So I got this game while I was looking for a new MMO to play. Big mistake. This is literally the worst MMORPG I have ever played in my life. If you're looking for a game to play, literally pick any other game and you'll have a more immersive experience. The gameplay is literally the most unimmersive thing ever. The monsters in this game literally just walk around, and when you touch them, you take damage. Sure, a few of them might have an attack or something, but they're generic, or undodgable, or both. They are generic and  have no counterplay and are just not fun to fight. As for your ability combos, they don't exist. You literally just spam the same thing over and over again, except for a few different characters, but even they just cast the same abilities in a loop over and over again. You also need to apply an excessive amount of buffs before you actually go and do stuff, and then you'd need to reapply them in a few minutes again, which I don't get the point of. The bossfights consist of undodgable attacks that will apply status effects for a few minutes at a time, usually a silence which would prevent you from using any skill at all, so you're just stuck there doing nothing, or you could be forced to move in a certain direction without warning. And because monsters deal touch damage in this game, it could make you ram into the boss and die. Teamwork is also not a part of the game at all, as the only healing class in the game has low demand, and small player base. Players will literally queue and then leave the party to fight solo. You are not reliant on healers, rather you gotta spend money to buy potions and chug them as you get hit by attacks you can't dodge. Heck, some bosses have a life counter because they know you're going to die from the lack of counterplay.The game will try to draw you in by giving you abilities that will unlock at higher levels, forcing you to grind mindlessly for long periods of time at the unimmersive mobs. Quests in this game all suck, they just involve picking stuff up or killing things and don't have a high enough reward to be worth doing.Once you get to higher levels, the game will try to appeal to you with excessive amounts of effects and 10 lines of damage numbers even though your attack only hits the enemy once. Then it becomes pay2win after that. You literally need to spend thousands of irl dollars in order to progress from that point on, or you won't be able to fight 90% of the bosses in the game. In addition, you also need to level several characters to a very high level in order to boost your main's stats, and that will take a long time PER CHARACTER. The gear progression is very linear, and everyone just wears the same stuff because it is the best. There aren't any items that are different from each other, so you can't experiment and do different kinds of builds.There are also no interesting places to explore, because it's a 2-D platformer game with no interesting scenery or terrain.Overall, this is a terrible game and literally play anything else other than this if you're looking for a new game to play. This game is just a massive, unimmersive grind just to see larger damage numbers.Oh, and the female characters are not heavily fanserviced. Literally unplayable.On a sidenote, I technically don't have this many hours in the game, because steam would think this game was open even though it was completely closed
